dialogues.speaker: TANGIER.
dialogues.text: INT. EVE’S APARTMENT - NIGHT At the center of an overhead image which is SLOWLY TURNIN CLOCKWISE, a woman [EVE] is lying on a bed. She is on her back, fully clothed, eyes closed, her hands symmetrically crossed over her chest. She appears to be i her late 30’s or early 40’s but, like ADAM, there is something ageless about her. She wears vintage white deni jacket and matching slim jeans, and boots. Her hair is pa blonde, her skin a luminous white, and lips colored deep with lipstick. The image, now wider, STOPS TURNING leaving her verticall composed on her island-like bed. The apartment is a singl large open room with bedroom, kitchenette, dining area, a foyer.  2. EVE is lying on a darkly iridescent Moroccan fabric. She remains completely motionless. Even her breathing is not perceptible. Berber carpets cover the floors around her. A gentle breeze moves darkly patterned curtains as faint sounds of the night drift in from the balcony: footsteps, voices speaking French and Arabic, a loud Arabic pop song from the radio of a moving car...eventually a distant cal prayer is audible. EVE’s eyes spring open. They are electric blue and completely alert, retaining no trace of sleep. She abrupt sits upright and looks at the vintage Chanel watch on her wrist, her lively eyes then glancing towards the windows.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (with an English accent) Oh, shit. She gracefully springs to her feet and moves toward the d Effortlessly, she sweeps a black and white head-scarf, an white western style Stetson hat, and a vintage shoulder-b from the surface of an elaborately inlaid table on her wa out the door.

dialogues.speaker: DETROIT.
dialogues.text: INT. ADAM’S LIVINGROOM - NIGHT The 45rpm record continues skipping on the turntable. ADA still on the sofa, head rolled back, pale and thin, shows sign of life. His breathing is not perceptible. The doorbell rings. ADAM’s eyes open. They are suddenly remarkably alert, but somehow world-weary. Without lifting his head he listens the skipping record. The doorbell rings again.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (with an English accent) Fuckin’ hell... He sits up, then stands, in one continuous, weary motion. makes his way across the room, following a narrow path through the instruments and equipment. Pulling a curtain back slightly, ADAM looks out his window. Below ADAM sees a young man [IAN] step back from the fron door and look up at the window. The young man, dressed imitatively of ADAM, carries a guitar case in one hand an waves up at ADAM with the other.  3. ADAM closes the curtain and moves away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM is reascending the stairs after letting IAN in, who follows behind him. ADAM now carries the worn guitar case

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (with American accent) Yeah, man, I finally found it for you. Hey, should I take my boots off? They’re all wet.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t bother.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ADAM’S LIVINGROOM - NIGHT The two men enter the livingroom and make their way to th rectangular coffee table in front of the sofa. ADAM clear the table and places the case on its surface. He flips th latches and opens it. Inside is an unusual electric guitar, weathered black wit aged-white pick-guard: a Supro from the 1950s. ADAM lifts from its case. He looks down the guitar’s neck, then runs his fingers up its fretboard.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (quietly) Very nice, Ian. Cheers.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (proudly) Yeah, and all the electronics and everything are original, of course. I made sure they all work.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (still examining the guitar) Just what the doctor ordered, as they say. There is a morose tone detectable in ADAM’s voice and movements, as he places the guitar upright on the sofa. ADAM (cont'd) I shall call him William Lawes.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: It’s male?  The two stand, looking down at the guitar.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: This one is, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: And who’s William Lawes?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (distracted) Oh, uh, just some old English guy. Wrote some great funeral music. (then even more distant) Then, during the English Civil War, he was casually shot by a Parliamentarian...

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Oh. (then after a longer pause) Adam, are you, uh, you ok? ADAM, miles away, sinks into the sofa while IAN moves equipment off a nearby brocade-covered chair. IAN (cont'd) (excitedly) You know, your new stuff is really echoing through the underground. It’s all over the place! (then sitting down) I mean, I know you never want to do anything live, I understand, but man I’m gettin’ more and more calls with offers all the time! One label offered a really huge advance. And I got several calls about scoring films, also offering a lot of money, man.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Let’s not talk about money, shall we. Don’t I pay you enough?

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: No, yeah! You pay me really well! You bought my car, and everything.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Good. Listen Ian, I don’t give a shit about money. You know that. (pause) I’m like Gomez Adams. Independently wealthy... IAN glances at the shabby walls and clutter of dusty equipment surrounding them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincerely) Well, maybe being so reclusive is only going to make everybody more interested in your music.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (after a pause) Yeah. What a drag. Then I’1l just have to...disappear...again...

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (curiously) Again? But again ADAM has drifted off, his brooding eyes fixed o something a thousand miles away. IAN (cont'd) Uh, what were you saying?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (only partially returning to the present) Listen, Ian, there is something you can do for me.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Sure. Anything. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (looking off) I need a bullet. A very special bullet.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: A .32 caliber bullet, but made of wood.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: A wooden bullet? Really?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yes, and made from the hardest and most dense wood possible. I would suggest ironwood, Lignum Vitae, or possibly snakewood, Piratineia Guianensis. Maybe African blackwood, Dalbergia Melanoxylon. Here. I’ve written them down. Think you can find someone who can make it for me? He hands IAN a small scrap of paper. IAN looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, uh. Yeah, I think I know someone who could, uh... (then looking up at ADAM) What the hell for, though?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (looking over at him) It’s for a rather secret project. An “art” project. ADAM lazily pulls a stack of folded bills from somewhere hands them to IAN.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Oh! Well, let me think. And, uh, does the shell casing have to be made of wood too? I mean, don’t they have to be made of brass or something?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, they do. The shell casing should be brass, but the bullet has to be pure wood. The heaviest, most dense wood.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Ok. A wooden bullet. (then, putting the cash in his coat pocket) Just one?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Just the one, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Ok, I’ll get right on it. (pause) Anything else weird that you need?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Can you jump start my car for me? ADAM stands up.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Really? Uh, sure. (then, also standing up) You going somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (distantly) Just for a drive. ADAM moves toward the door, putting on a leather jacket i the process and picking up a worn leather doctor’s bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (now following) Uh, shouldn’t we talk about some more music stuff?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (going out the door) Let’s not, shall we?

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (following him out) Well, do you want some company?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ADAM’S HOUSE - NIGHT On the slushy street in front of ADAM’s house, IAN stands near the open hood of ADAM’s dirty white Jaguar, a 1989 X coupe. Jumper cables connect its battery to the one in IA late-model BMW 3 Series. ADAM sits behind the wheel of his Jag, turns the ignition its engine fires up.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Cheers Ian! Let me know about that bullet, yeah? Just between us.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (disconnecting cables) Of course. As always. IAN watches the ghostly white Jag pull away, a hint of fo rising off the surrounding slush and snow. The car disappears into a background of abandoned industrial buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her head and face now covered by Stetson hat and Arab sca EVE’s luminous blue eyes lead her through the narrow corridors of the Medina. Though approaching 5am, the passageways still show shadowy signs of nefarious activit Several times, men emerge from darkened doorways and appr EVE as she passes. They speak in Arabic, or French, or English, all offering her “something very special”. EVE, however, is unfazed, moving cautiously, but somehow flowi past them like water. She crosses the square of the Grand Socco, where men gath near several small cafes and bars.  8. Some chatter to her as she moves past and enters another Narrow passage across the square. Again descending, several women, covered with brightly colored Riffian shawls, observe her curiously from the shadows as she approaches the end of the passageway. It empties onto another, smaller, square: the Petit Socco EVE pauses, eyes scanning the only open cafe on the squar Its lit sign reads: ONE THOUSAND AND ONE NIGHTS. EVE heads across the square toward the cafe’s illuminatio her face still covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM’s face is concealed by a white surgical mask, his ha pulled up under a pale blue surgeon’s cap. Only his inten eyes are recognizable. He walks deliberately through the dingy florescence of a hospital corridor. Dressed in a white lab coat over pale green scrubs, ADAM carries the outdated leather doctor’s bag in one hand, a stethoscope hanging around his neck. His eyes unobtrusively survey the details around him: Two oblivious male nurses talk in Spanish adjacent to a v elderly man on a gurney who is coughing violently. Two more gurneys pass silently, their occupants completel covered by sheets, including their heads. An older, hagga female nurse pushes the second of these. Her tired eyes, though seeking sympathy, glance at ADAM as he passes. He pauses in front of an open door to a small room. Insid nurse applies pressure to a wad of white gauze covering a wound on the leg of a reclining female patient. Blood is soaking into the gauze. ADAM’s eyes fix on the seeping blood, following several drops that fall onto the floor. eyes have widened, triggered by a primal urge that he visibly, though subtly, fights to suppress. Noticing him nurse, then patient, both look over in his direction. ADA collects himself and continues moving down the corridor. Outside another doorway, he passes a male patient in hosp gown sitting catatonically in a wheelchair, an unlit cigarette in his half-open mouth. A tube runs from his ar to an I.V. on a stand attached to the wheelchair. The I.V  9. bag appears to contain blood. Again ADAM’s eyes flash, bu he keeps walking. At the end of this corridor ADAM passes through two unmar white swinging doors. Inside this area only a few doctors are visible, drinking coffee and talking somberly. ADAM passes through another set of unmarked swinging door Here, surrounded by several electronic machines, two male doctors talk with an attractive female in a white lab coa One nods to ADAM as he passes. ADAM nods back, passing another man in white lab coat, asleep in a nearby chair. At the end of a short white hallway ADAM pauses, briefly looking back, before opening a single white door, this on marked: RESTRICTED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM, almost silently, enters a room lined with glass-cov shelves, the shelves lined with medications and restricte supplies. A single technician, a PHARMACIST, in white lab coat, sit a metal table, his back turned to ADAM. On the table’s surface, his white gloved hands utilize a flat knife-like instrument, as he deftly separates a large pile of loose capsules by color. Just beyond this table, behind more glass shelves is anot smaller room. On its glass door a sign reads: ATTENTION TEMPERATURE CONTROL. Suspended bags of plasma and blood a visible inside. Adam silently steps closer watching over the man’s should The PHARMACIST pauses for a moment, shifting to write a number on a clipboard. Then, detecting ADAM’s presence, h suddenly turns toward him.

dialogues.speaker: PHARMACIST
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus! You half-scared the shit out of me. The jittery PHARMACIST swivels in his chair. He appears t be a little younger than ADAM, with dark-framed glasses a post-collegiate haircut. Unlike ADAM, he wears a white sh and tie under his lab coat. PHARMACIST (cont'd) I’ve sort of been expecting you recently, for some reason, Doctor uh...Doctor Who. ADAM takes a thick stack of folded bills from a pocket an hands them to the PHARMACIST.  10. After glancing over ADAM’s shoulder toward the door, the PHARMACIST counts the bills at lightning speed (almost li magic trick) before nervously pocketing them. PHARMACIST (cont'd) You know, this, uh, this set-up is a bit unnerving for me. Wouldn’t you consider meeting somewhere outside the hospital sometime? Instead of just appearing unexpectedly like a...phantom?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: That would require pre-arrangement.

dialogues.speaker: PHARMACIST
dialogues.text: I know, but, it would be much safer for me.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I like to come to the source. Also the mutual jeopardy makes me feel safer. Excuse me, but I don’t have any spare time. ADAM deliberately places his doctor’s bag on the metal ta his own white-gloved hands holding it open. Nervously the PHARMACIST stands up.

dialogues.speaker: PHARMACIST
dialogues.text: Right, let me get you what you need, uh, Doctor. (pause) By the way, that stethoscope you have there is practically an antique. (then turning away) From the 1970s, or maybe even the ‘60s...

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (cautiously watching the PHARMACIST’s back as he opens the door to the inner room) Is it? (pause) Well, still serves its purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVE is seated at a small table near the cafe’s front wind her scarf now lowered around her neck. EVE glances at her watch, then out the window. An untouched glass of mint te sits on the table in front of her.  ll. Beyond her is a small bar area where several men with tir eyes converse laconically in Arabic. Rai music floats fro a small radio on a shelf behind them. EVE’s alert eyes move again from the window to her watch, then over to the men at the bar. One of them with large, sympathetic, sleepy eyes: the BARMAN, looks over at her.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (in Arabic to the BARMAN) You sure he wasn’t here earlier? The BARMAN shakes his head, then gestures with both hands indicating that he has no answer. Just then, all heads tu to the door. Moments later a man enters [MARLOWE]. He is an older man, but striking; his eyes assured, but cautious. He is thin and wears a trimmed beard and an odd mixture of clothing representing both the late Sixteenth late Twentieth centuries. Dangling from one pale hand are two white, unmarked plastic bags, like those from a pharm MARLOWE nods to the men at the bar, who respectfully retu the gesture as though greeting the owner or boss. MARLOWE approaches EVE, who smiles. She rises from the small tabl EVE (cont'd) Hello, darling. Embracing him, she kisses his cheek, then both sit down. EVE (cont'd) There’s only an hour ‘til sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: MARLOWE
dialogues.text: I’m aware of that, my dear. He places one of the white bags on the floor next to EVE. She immediately leans over and carefully places it inside vintage shoulder bag.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (again smiling) Is it the really good stuff?

dialogues.speaker: MARLOWE
dialogues.text: Yes, Eve. It is.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (whispering) From the French doctor?

dialogues.speaker: MARLOWE
dialogues.text: Precisely.  12.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (now louder) I’m so happy to see you Christopher Marlowe! One of the men at the bar briefly glances over at them.

dialogues.speaker: MARLOWE
dialogues.text: (quietly but very sternly) I’ve told you a thousand times to never, ever, call me that ina public place.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (playfully drawn to his crankiness) Yes, I know, darling. But it’s so difficult to continue hiding such a delicious secret.

dialogues.speaker: MARLOWE
dialogues.text: (glancing over his shoulder) Eve, please...

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (again whispering, eyes twinkling) The most outrageous scandal in literary history!

dialogues.speaker: MARLOWE
dialogues.text: (defensively) Eve, stop. I beg you. (pause) Anyway, no one would believe me...not in...four hundred years. He begins to drift away. Noticing, EVE reaches over and places her hand on MARLOWE’s sleeve. After a brief pause, she pulls her hand back.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Kit, have you really been wearing this frock since 1590? He looks away, a twinge of guilt briefly crossing his fac EVE stands to leave, leaning in to give MARLOWE a kiss on cheek. EVE (cont'd) (quietly) I do wish we could let the world know one day. It would cause such thrilling chaos.  13.

dialogues.speaker: MARLOWE
dialogues.text: I think the world has more than enough chaos to contend with.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Perhaps you’re right, Doctor Faustus. She laughs as MARLOWE briefly glares at her. EVE then goe out the door, MARLOWE watching through the window as she pulls her scarf over her face and crosses the Petit Socco MARLOWE, clasping his own white plastic bag, then also ri to leave.

dialogues.speaker: OVER BLACK
dialogues.text: “Inside water, a water wheel turns. A star circulates with the moon.” - Rumi

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ADAM’S LIVINGROOM - NIGHT ADAM enters his livingroom, still wearing green hospital scrubs, but under his leather jacket and minus the lab-co mask, and surgeons cap. He is carrying the vintage leathe doctor’s bag. Making his way to the coffee table, he lifts off the guit case and replaces it with his doctor’s bag. Opening it, A carefully unwraps something covered by the white lab coat It’s a large, white, plastic bag, sealed at the top. It makes a dull thud as ADAM places it on the low table, indicating its weight.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (to himself) Ahh, finally. Time to get straight. He steps away, removing his jacket. As he leaves the room he is heard mumbling to himself. ADAM (cont'd) Doctor fucking Who...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. EVE’S APARTMENT —- PREDAWN EVE enters her apartment, locking the door behind her and pulling off her scarf.  14. She crosses the room and ties the thick curtains tightly shut. She then re-crosses, approaching a small, round, elaborat carved, Moroccan table with two delicate velvet-covered chairs on either side. Pausing there, she carefully lifts the white plastic bag from her shoulder bag and places it the table. Her eyes are alive as she opens the bag. Inside is a seal white paper bag, which she in turn lifts out and places o the table. It makes a heavy THUNK.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Ooh, the really good stuff! She steps away from the small table.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ADAM’S LIVINGROOM - NIGHT ADAM returns to his sofa, now bare-chested under a frayed dark brocade bathrobe. He is barefoot, but wearing his sl ‘60s style trousers with dark vertical stripes. In one ha is a clear glass test-tube. He sits on the sofa, the back Supro guitar still propped to him, and opens the white bag. He lifts out one of seve cylindrical, stainless steel canisters. It is shaped like thermos, but taller and more slender. He delicately unscr the steel top.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. EVE’S APARTMENT —- PREDAWN EVE, now wearing a Moroccan robe with a gold pattern agai black, places a delicately-stemmed crystal apéritif glass the small carved table next to the white bag. Sitting dow her eyes indicate a childlike excitement as she opens the sealed, white bag. Carefully she lifts one of several cylindrical containers from the bag. Its top is stainless steel but the slender container is clear glass. Inside is a thick, dark red flu Eyes dancing as she unscrews the cap, she then gently pou some of the thick fluid into the crystal apéritif glass. A platinum wedding ring is visible on her finger as she raises the glass above her head.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Here’s to you, Adam, my love.  15. She brings the glass to her deep red lips and drinks.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ADAM’S LIVINGROOM - NIGHT ADAM holds up the test tube, now half filled with a dark fluid. A platinum wedding ring is visible on his thin whi finger.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: To you, Eve. I love you more than...all the tea in China. He raises the test tube to his lips and drinks.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. EVE’S APARTMENT —- PREDAWN EVE wipes a drip of red fluid from the corner of her mout with a patterned handkerchief. She then rises and floats toward her bed. She pauses at a low, painted chest next to the bed. On it surface are a pair of very modern looking Harman Kardon speakers incased in glass tubes and connected by a wire t white iPod. EVE’s delicate white fingers press a button on the iPod’s circular control panel.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ADAM’S LIVINGROOM - NIGHT ADAM’s hands now place another 45rpm record on one of his turntables. He places the tonearm on the record, then ste away. Seen from above a very relaxed ADAM, as though in slow motion, falls into a sitting position on his sofa. His he falls back, his legs splayed out in front of him. Music begins to flow from the record player [”Funnel of Love” b Wanda Jackson].

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. EVE’S APARTMENT —- PREDAWN Also seen from overhead and as though in slow motion, EVE falls onto her bed.  16. The same music [”Funnel of Love” by Wanda Jackson] fills room. [This overhead image begins to SLOWLY SPIN CLOCKWIS

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ADAM’S LIVINGROOM - NIGHT ADAM, again seen from overhead, is also now SPINNING SLOW CLOCKWISE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These two images, spinning ADAM and spinning EVE, are intercut (or possibly interdissolved) with the spinning turntable. As these images continue to spin they graduall become closer and closer until the faces of ADAM and EVE the screen, their eyes slowly closing in trance-like blis FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: FADE UP TO
dialogues.text: INT. EVE’S APARTMENT - NIGHT The heavy curtains across EVE’s balcony are unmoving, tig fastened across the windows. Still wearing her black and gold robe, she arrives at the curtains and opens them slightly. She reaches through the opening for the handle the balcony’s glass doors. Opening them a little, she the pulls the curtains open wider. EVE looks out over the rooftops of Tangier, huddled under black sky. A faint breeze lightly moves the curtain next her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The curtains over ADAM’s window are tightly drawn and unmoving. Still wearing his dark, brocade robe, he arrive at the window and gently pulls on one of the gold antique cords that fasten the curtains. Accidentally, the curtain briefly separate. For a fraction of a second a slit of pa light leaks through, a streak of it crossing the back of ADAM’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (out loud) Oww! Shit! He re-ties the cord, and examines his hand. A thin, red b is visible.  17. ADAM pulls a black handkerchief from a nearby lamp and quickly wraps it around his wound. ADAM (cont'd) (to himself) Bloody fuckin’ hell. You’d think that after a few hundred years...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. EVE’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Still in her Moroccan robe, EVE falls back onto her bed. white iPhone-like device in one hand. She turns the phone and dials a series of numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Among ADAM’s menagerie of equipment, a phone rings. ADAM crosses the room and locates a cordless handset on a larg table piled with more equipment -- including an old CRT T screen with a camera of some kind attached on top. ADAM sinks back into his sofa as he answers.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (voice on phone) Hey, handsome. (pause) It’s me.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (softly into phone) Eve...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. EVE’S APARTMENT - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (reclining on her bed, phone to her ear) Turn on your contraption so I can see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM is seen pushing a switch on a box hand-wired into another box which is wired into the TV set.  18. The TV’s screen gradually illuminates, along with a small LED light above the camera lens on top of the TV. ADAM then falls back onto the sofa, phone to his ear, eye the TV screen. EVE’s face is now visible on the screen, a she apparently holds her phone device out in front of her

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Ah, there you are, my love.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (on screen) Hello, darling.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Hello, gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. EVE’S APARTMENT - NIGHT EVE’s device is seen in her hand, apparently held out in front of her. Adam’s head and shoulders can be seen on th device’s small rectangular screen. His eyes have now softened, somehow appearing more languid than before.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (speaking off-screen) You look tired

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (on EVE’s screen) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (tenderly, on ADAM’s screen, her handheld camera moving closer on her face) Oh, what’s the matter, baby? (then smiling a little) Miss me too much?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (on EVE’s screen, after a sullen pause) Maybe...Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (on ADAM’s screen, a little less close to her camera) Ooh. But it was your idea, Adam, your “I vont to be alone” routine. (her hand now on her forehead ala Gretta Garbo) And it hasn’t even been a year yet.  19.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (on EVE’s screen) I’m fine.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (voice off-screen) You're the worst actor I’ve ever seen. You know that? On EVE’s screen ADAM is seen getting up from the sofa and “dramatically” approaching his camera.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Vot I vont is to bite your neck! EVE, on ADAM’s screen, laughs, her laughter gently shakin the image on the screen. She then randomly twirls her cam around for a moment, images of her apartment flying past, before it returns to frame her face.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (still on ADAM’s screen) Oh, Adam. You know you're impossible. Tell your affection starved wife what your bloody problem is, will you please? ADAM, on EVE'S screen, sits quietly for a moment looking from the camera.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (still on EVE’s screen) I don’t know. He looks back toward the camera. Off-screen EVE can be he sighing.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (voice off-screen) Another bad depression? There is no response from ADAM. EVE (cont'd) (voice again off-screen) Any supply problems?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (on EVE’s screen) No. There is a long pause before EVE speaks again.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (voice off-screen, concerned) Are you just being dramatic?  20. ADAM, on EVE’s screen, shakes his head, then lowers it, o hand entangling itself in his long messy hair. EVE, now on ADAM’s screen, looks directly into the lens o her device. Her eyes now show a combination of sadness, compassion, and concern. EVE (cont'd) (on ADAM'’s screen) Do you...do you want to come here? And be with me? (pause) Please?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (on EVE’s screen, looking away ) Oh, I’d just be an albatross around your irresistible neck.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (now on ADAM’s screen) I have a really strong neck. And it needs some kind of jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (off-screen) Should I send pearls? Black pearls?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (on ADAM'’s screen) I still have the beautiful strand you gave me two hundred years ago. Anyway, right now I’d prefer a nice scruffy albatross. There is another pause, neither speaking for several mome

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO SCREENS
dialogues.text: EVE (cont'd) Will you please just talk to me for a minute?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Oh, Adam. You've been deeply depressed before. Remember the 1820s? And your reaction to the first World War, that did scare the shit out of me, to say nothing of the Spanish Civil War. Then the 1950s...the ‘70s...  21.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, definitely all deeply depressing times.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, well you should have lived through the fucking Vandals. Or the Tartars. The floods, the plagues. Fuckin’ hell...

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (flatly) Sounds exciting.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (after a pause) What about your music? On EVE’s screen, ADAM sullenly surveys his instruments an equipment surrounding him.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I seem to be writing a lot of funeral music.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Oh, Adam...Why don’t you just fucking come here and kiss me? In the past you so loved Tangier. (pause) You loved the music. And those times when your friends all lived here -- Burroughs and Brion Gysin. Paul Bowles, Brian Jones...

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (quietly) I wouldn’t make it there, Eve.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Seriously? There is a long pause. EVE (cont'd) Oh, fuck. (pause) Alright. I‘1l come. On EVE’s screen ADAM’s averted eyes return to the camera. EVE (cont'd) But I can’t believe you’re doing this to me again. And tell me why again you’re in, of all places on this planet, fucking Detroit? On EVE’s screen ADAM can be seen shrugging and looking aw  22.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Suits my mood. I guess. (pause) I‘1l tell you one thing I love about Detroit -- you can be whatever you want here.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Well, that’s always a plus.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Other than that, I guess it’s an end of the world kind of thing...

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: You really are too much, Adam. You know I still largely blame Keats and Shelley for your hopelessly romantic affliction. And a few of those French assholes too.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Listen, Eve. I don’t think you should come. Listen to me. Don’t come. It’s gotten way too weird out there.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, in three thousand years momma’s seen weirder times than these. (then, half to herself) Although, not by much, I must say...It’s just the traveling that’s such a drag. (pause) Don’t worry baby. I’11 just pack the bags, ‘cause we’re going on a guilt trip. Seen on ADAM’s screen, EVE smiles and sends him a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Don’t come, Eve. Really. (pause) I love you more than...all the tea in China. EVE laughs and switches off her phone. From his velvet couch, ADAM watches the screen of his antiquated TV. It darkens, gradually fading to a white do at its center, the dot then eventually blinking off.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO BLACK
dialogues.text: “You have said what you are. I am what I am. Your actions in my head, my head here in my hands  23. with something circling inside. I have no name for what circles so perfectly.” - Rumi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVE and MARLOWE walk arm in arm, along the Place de Franc the Ville Nouvelle section, the architecture around them still faintly echoing a decayed form of 1930s glamour.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: You sure you'll be ok? I can’t stand the thought of my not being an absolute necessity. I wish you could go with me, and help me drag Adam back over here.

dialogues.speaker: MARLOWE
dialogues.text: Oh, god no. Traveling these last years, for me, is bordering on impossible. (then gesturing around him) And why would I want to go anywhere else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit down on a low wall overlooking the port, a shutt and crumbling Deco hotel in the shadows behind them.

dialogues.speaker: MARLOWE
dialogues.text: (looking out at the black glistening water) I had a dream about your sister last night. (he turns to her) Your infamous little sister...

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: You had a dream about Ava?

dialogues.speaker: MARLOWE
dialogues.text: Do you even know where she is these days?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (looking off) No. I have no idea. (pause) What happened in the dream, Kit? Marlowe stares out at the water, not answering.  24. EVE (cont'd) Kit? Did you hear me? (pause) Hey, Christopher!

dialogues.speaker: MARLOWE
dialogues.text: (returning) What? Oh. I’m sorry, I...I drifted away for a moment. (he gazes again at the water) To Italy, actually. A few hundred years ago...

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Was he painfully good looking? He turns back to her.

dialogues.speaker: MARLOWE
dialogues.text: What? (pause) Eve, I know I don’t need to tell you this, but please be cautious. I couldn’t bear it if anything happened to you. EVE gently puts her hands on his hand.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: You don’t need to worry about me, darling.

dialogues.speaker: MARLOWE
dialogues.text: Alright, then. In any case, deliver my regards to that suicidally romantic scoundrel.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: MARLOWE
dialogues.text: (his gaze again drifting away ) God, I wish I’d known Adam before writing Hamlet. He would have provided the most perfect case- study imaginable. Eve studies MARLOWE for a moment, as he stares off into t silvery darkness.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. EVE’S APARTMENT —- PREDAWN EVE’s curtains are drawn shut, the area around her bed illuminated by electric lamps with ornate metal Moroccan shades.  25. She sits on the bed, legs folded under her to one side, a open suitcase on the floor nearby. White mobile phone to her head, EVE’s other hand sifts through several dozen credit cards fanned out in front of her. Next to them are a variety of passports and bundles cash in pounds, dollars, euros, etc. EVE’s eyes are bright and alert as she speaks into her ph

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes, but is there a night flight from Tangier to Paris? (pause) Yes. That’s great. And is there any possibility of flying at night from Paris to Detroit? (pause) Yeah, Detroit...(pause) Brilliant. And what time does it arrive in Detroit? Her fingers select a gold credit card. EVE (cont'd) (into phone) Midnight Detroit time? Oh, that sounds lovely. (she laughs) Yeah. Alright then, I want to book those two flights, please, for one person. She raises the card in front of her. EVE (cont'd) (into phone) Oh, uh... She glances at her watch. EVE (cont'd) For tonight.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ADAM’S LIVINGROOM - NIGHT Reels of recording tape slowly turn on a vintage upright to-reel machine, connected by cables to several old microphones placed around the room. A single, harmonically complex and distorted chord sustai in a long drone. As it fades, it starts again. ADAM sits upright, eyes closed, on his sofa. He is playin the black electric Supro guitar. As the previous drone fa away, ADAM strikes the guitar strings again. The tone is mesmerizing, like broken bells heard from a distance.  26. The doorbell rings. ADAM’s eyes open. He strikes the chor again, and again the doorbell rings, the two sounds mergi in harmonic dissonance. After another ring, ADAM lets the last guitar chord fade ringing feedback, then stands and lays the guitar on the sofa. He crosses to the window and, opening the curtains very slightly, looks out. Below, three or four young people ar standing out on the street in front of ADAM’s house. Thei clothes are imitative of a previous period of Detroit rock'n'roll, suggesting they are dedicated, or curious, f of ADAM’s underground music. They stand near a beat-up economy car, talking. One points back towards ADAM’s hous

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (to himself) Fuckin’ hell... The “fans” squeeze back into their small car, slamming cl its doors. The car can be heard pulling away as ADAM cros back to the sofa and sits down. His brooding eyes fix on the tape machine, watching the l of the tape slip from the empty reel and thread it’s fina path through the tape-heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVE sits in a first class seat near the window, an empty next to her. As usual, her appearance is striking and she stands out dramatically from the other passengers. She we dark glasses, white denim jacket and white jeans, with he large black and white Arab scarf draped around her neck. Her vintage shoulder bag is cradled in her lap, on top of her hands cradling a small antique book, opened. It is a book of Shakespeare’s sonnets. EVE briefly reads several lines, silently, which are hear her voice over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark how with my neglect I do dispense: You are so strongly in my purpose bred That all the world besides, me thinks, are dead. EVE (cont'd) (out loud, but softly) Marlowe...  27. Gently closing the book, EVE looks at the window, its vie onto nothing but blackness. Hearing a muffled grunt from across the aisle, EVE turns time to notice that a male passenger in business clothes just cut his finger on the pull-tab of a beer can. She lowers her dark glasses and watches intently as a small amount of blood drips from the tiny wound onto the man’s table. Fixed on the blood, her eyes flare briefly as she watches the passenger wrap his finger in a white paper napkin, a bit more blood soaking into it. After a moment, she reluctantly turns her head away and repositions her d glasses. Just then, an announcement in French is heard over the plane’s speakers.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCEMENT
dialogues.text: (in French) We will soon begin our descent into Orly International Airport. Please remain in your seats with seat- belts fastened. Thank you. As EVE places the small book inside her shoulder bag, a female FLIGHT ATTENDANT makes her way down the aisle, checking seat-belts and seat-back positions. She pauses briefly next to EVE’s seat, addressing her cheerfully.

dialogues.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: (in English with a pronounced French accent) Oh, I really like your scarf. You know this is now very chic in Paris!

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Is it? Oh. Thank you. The FLIGHT ATTENDANT smiles, nodding, and moves off down aisle. When she is out of sight, EVE briefly glances in h direction, then quickly unwinds her scarf from her neck a contrarily stuffs it into the bag on her lap.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ADAM’S LIVINGROOM - NIGHT ADAM, in his bathrobe, is sitting on his sofa quietly strumming an antique acoustic guitar. After a few moments, the doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (to himself) Shit...  28. It rings again, and ADAM stands and crosses to the window Below, ADAM sees IAN stepping back from the door and look up toward him. ADAM closes the curtain, and moves away fr the window.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ADAM’S LIVINGROOM - NIGHT ADAM stands at the door to the hallway staircase IAN’s ascending footsteps audible. ADAM motions him in, as IAN enters the room, catching his breath.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: I didn’t wake you, did I? ADAM shakes his head as the two cross the room, ADAM sink into the sofa, IAN sitting on the edge of a cluttered cha IAN (cont'd) Yeah. No. I mean, I know to only come by at night. ADAM looks at him, vaguely irritated. IAN (cont'd) (quickly reaching into his pocket) Oh! I got it for you! IAN retrieves a small velvet bag, like those from a jewel He quickly stands, handing it over to ADAM. IAN (cont'd) (as ADAM opens the small bag and empties its contents into his hand) A wooden bullet, .32 caliber. ADAM gently rolls the bullet in his palm -- a dark, polis wooden bullet in a brass jacket. IAN (cont'd) It’s Cocobolo.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (examining the bullet) Yeah, Dalbergia Retusa.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (proudly) For your art project! (pause) The guy made it for me, no questions asked. He said the wood is so dense it sinks in water. I think they use it on guitars sometimes.  29.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: That’s true. ADAM closes his fist around the wooden bullet, and looks at IAN. ADAM (cont'd) Perfect. Thank you, Ian.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: No problem, man. ADAM pulls a wad of bills from the pocket of his robe and hands it to IAN. IAN (cont'd) (taking the cash) Oh, no, man. You already paid me for... ADAM gestures, and IAN is quiet. IAN quickly pockets the money. IAN (cont'd) Thanks. (pause) Everything else ok?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Listen, there were some, like, rock'n'roll kids ringing my doorbell last night.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Really? But how could they possibly know where...

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) I don’t know, but it’s not cool.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Of course not! It’s fucked up. (pause) But don’t worry. I’m gonna...I’m gonna spread some rumors. You know, very cautiously, about where you might live. You know, throw them way off the track. ADAM stands up.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, whatever. Listen, I need to...  30.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (springing up excitedly) But, man, it’s like there’s a new scene about to happen in Detroit! I can feel it, man. ADAM moves toward the door, IAN following, still talking excitedly. IAN (cont'd) It’s gonna happen again! I mean, back in the old days we had The White Stripes, The Dirtbombs, Detroit Cobras, The Von Bondies, Brendan Benson...

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Please, Ian. Now you’re really starting to freak me out. Let’s calm down. (pause) I’11l see you later. I have something to attend to.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (winding down) Oh. Oh, yeah, sure. ADAM ushers him out the door. IAN (V.0.) (cont'd) (descending the stairs) See you soon, then. ADAM waits, until the heavy door can be heard closing beh IAN downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM sits on his heavy, carved, antique bed in the bedroo his house. Much like his livingroom, this room is also cluttered, heavily curtained, its decor mixing several centuries. Its dark walls are lined with framed reproductions of portraits of artists, musicians, writers scientists. ADAM looks down at his hand, which holds a silver plated, caliber revolver with pearl handles. He uncurls his other fist, revealing the wooden bullet, cased in brass. Flipping over the pistol’s revolving magazine, ADAM slide the wooden bullet into one of the six empty chambers. Wit another flip of his wrist, the magazine clicks back into place.  31. ADAM takes a deep breath, then spins the revolving magazi When it stops spinning he turns the gun, placing the end its barrel on his chest, aimed directly into his heart. ADAM closes his eyes and gently pulls the trigger. The hammer clicks loudly against an empty chamber. After a moment ADAM opens his eyes, slowly lowering the gun from chest. CUT TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: OVER BLACK
dialogues.text: “Whoever finds love beneath hurt and grief disappears into emptiness with a thousand new disguises.” - Rumi

dialogues.speaker: FADE UP TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ADAM’S HOUSE - NIGHT A taxi is stopped in front of ADAM’s house, just beyond h dirty but elegant, white Jaguar XJ-S. The street is cover in ice and grey slush. EVE, again with hat and scarf and shoulder-bag, stands ne to the DRIVER. He wears a worn parka and lifts her suitca from the open trunk.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Well, welcome to Detroit.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (in Arabic, handing him money ) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: (in Arabic, getting back into the cab) May Allah bless you.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (in English) May the great mystery bless us all. As the taxi pulls away down the frozen street, EVE pauses look up at ADAM’s house. Soft lights barely leak through drawn curtains covering the upstairs windows. EVE’s hand affectionately grazes ADAM’s Jag as she passes EVE (cont'd) (smiling to herself) Ah yes, 1989.  32. She opens the gate and, entering the yard, stops suddenly freezing in place. A large raccoon looks up at her throug masked eyes as it crosses the walkway leading to ADAM’s d EVE (cont'd) (identifying the animal by its Latin name) Oh. Procyon Lotor. The raccoon lumbers off, disappearing into the shadows. EVE arrives at the door and presses the doorbell. It ring inside, as EVE sets down her suitcase. Behind the door sh hears footsteps rapidly descending the staircase, and a moment later the door swings open. ADAM, fully dressed, sees her and momentarily freezes in doorway. ADAM and EVE gaze into each other’s radiant eyes ADAM steps out and embraces her. They pull back slightly, again gazing at one another. Their lips meet in a long ki of reunited lovers. ADAM steps back, his hands still on EVE’s waist, both now perceptibly dizzy. EVE (cont'd) (softly) Hello. After a pause, ADAM picks up her suitcase, then steps asi to let her enter. She hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry. (he gestures) Won’t you please come in? EVE smiles and, removing her hat, steps past him. ADAM follows, closing the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ADAM’S LIVINGROOM - PREDAWN ADAM and EVE, wearing only dark bathrobes, are curled aro each other on the sofa. ADAM’s unusual electric guitar mu plays from a reel-to-reel recorder, though not loudly, in background. The room is softly lit, the curtains fully closed. On the table in front of them is an opened stainless canister, lying on its side, empty. ADAM and EVE each hol blood-tinged apéritif glass in one hand. They uncurl just enough to ‘clink’ glasses before draining them. They laug as though drunk, their teeth and lips noticeably tinted a dark red. EVE reaches out to place her empty glass on the table, but it slips and falls to the floor, rolling under sofa.  33.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (leaning back into ADAM’s arms ) I think maybe we’ve overdone it.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (as though intoxicated) Yeah... They remain silent, content, enfolded, the music a lyrica fog around them.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: I love your newest music.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Thanks. It’s called ‘I Drank Your Mother’s Blood, and She Tasted Like a Whore’. EVE laughs, pulling away a little, and playfully punching ADAM in the chest.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (settling back into ADAM’s arms ) Yeah, right. Hey, Mr. Guitar man. Do you know: ‘I Drank Your Mother's Blood, and She Tasted Like a Whore’?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (completing the joke) Know it! I fuckin’ wrote it! EVE laughs again, and ADAM too, a little.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: You know, it does concern me that you’ve finally let your music go out into the world. You’ve always been so careful about it, only sending it anonymously to other composers.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. But that was the only way I could hear it performed. To just give it away...

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: So why did you release this recent stuff?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (distantly) I don’t know. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM (cont'd) A failed experiment, probably. I guess I just wanted something out there before I...

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Before what? (pause) You know, you always conveniently have the mortals to blame when you sink into depression, but then, what you really care about is all their most beautiful accomplishments. What about all your artist heroes?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I don’t have heroes.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Oh no? What about your beloved scientists?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, look what they’ve done to them. Look at Pythagoras. They slaughtered him and his commune. Galileo -- imprisoned. Capernicus - - ridiculed. Newton -- pushed into secrecy and alchemy. Tesla -- destroyed, and his beautiful possibilities ignored. And they’re still bitching about Darwin! Yeah, so much for the scientists.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Come on Adam, if we’re going to start cataloguing the atrocities of human history, those are probably very minor examples.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (distant again) Well, now they’ve even succeeded in contaminating their own fuckin’ blood, let alone their water. (pause) I just feel so...fragile.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: We are fragile. Everything is. But how amazing it is to observe all the details of history flowing by!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Easy for you. You have three thousand years of experience.  35.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, well our time will end, too. But first I intend, if possible, to watch it all just get washed away...like the momentary waves in the ocean, the stars fading from the black sky... Her words trail off. She turns her head a little, gently kissing ADAM’s neck. ADAM, looking off, caresses her hair with one hand. The music on the tape machine has ended. EVE (cont'd) I don’t want you to leave me, Adam. At least we have each other.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (after a pause) Eve, are you at all familiar with what Einstein termed “spooky action at a distance”?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (quietly) No. Sounds intriguing. (pause, her eyes closing) But maybe you better tell me about it later, ‘cause it’s gonna get light out. We better go to bed, baby.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. After a pause, his free arm stretches back and pulls up a antique acoustic guitar from somewhere behind the sofa. ADAM (cont'd) Eve?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (eyes closed) Mmmm?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Can you tell me how old this one is? I think it’s an L2, but I haven’t been able to date it exactly. Can you just... EVE half opens her eyes and squints at the guitar.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (sleepily) She’s a pretty one. Her thin white hand reaches over and briefly caresses the wooden instrument.  36. EVE (cont'd) (her hand retracting) 1905...

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Really? (pause) 1905...She is old.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (eyes again closing, her hand on his sleeve) Umm hmm...and did you realize your bathrobe is over a hundred and fifty years old?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Oh at least. She nuzzles deeper into ADAM’s shoulder. He strums a sing sad chord on the antique guitar, letting it ring and fade away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM and EVE are in bed together side by side, naked, asl Gradually EVE wakes, squinting as though through a hangov She sleepily surveys her surroundings before her thin arm reaches an antique lamp on the bed-stand and switches it ADAM stirs and wakes. Seeing EVE, he kisses her, and snak an arm around her. They gaze happily into each other’s ey

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Glad to see me? ADAM kisses her again, rolling over on top of her. Again they look into each others eyes, EVE smiling happily. EVE (cont'd) Oh, I think I’m a bit hungover, my love. (pause) Your supply is an excellent vintage, I must say. Quite delicious.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. Type O Negative. Nice and pure. Uncut. He rolls off her, now lying at her side, both gazing at t ceiling.  37.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (lazily) Did you know only female mosquitoes suck blood? (pause) Oh, but of course you did.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: And only female wasps and bees can sting, my love.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something unrelated? (pause) When they built Stonehenge, it was your people, right? Your Druids?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: I’m a Bructeri Druid, but close enough.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know, Bructeri. In any case, I was wondering how in the hell they moved those giant stones. Because I read recently somewhere that the stones weren’t from the surrounding area.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Well, first of all, we didn’t construct Stonehenge. A culture previous to us did. But we learned that they dragged those stones across land on, like, sort of giant sleds that rolled over a moveable system of strong wooden rails lined with spherical stone bearings.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (fascinated) I suspected as much. (pause) Did they use a similar system when the Egyptians built the pyramids?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (laughing) How fuckin’ old do you think I am? ADAM laughs a little as EVE now rolls on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I’ve always had a thing for older women.  38.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (smiling) And I love being a cradle-robber. She caresses his face. EVE (cont'd) I‘’1l tell you one thing, though.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: It’s a good thing we both got turned before we were too old to fuck.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (playing) Did we?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Yes. Allow me to demonstrate.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think we better make sure. But first could you switch that lamp off? It’s burning my bloody eyes. EVE lithely reaches over and switches it off. Darkness.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (softly) You know, I should correct myself.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: The Egyptians. In true fact they built their pyramids at least a thousand years later than Stonehenge.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Huh. Yeah, I thought so.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Oh, did you? They roll over, entwined, ADAM now on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM and EVE sit across from each other, carefully studyi chessboard between them on the kitchen table. Both again wear their dark bathrobes, EVE with her Stetson hat pushe back on her head. In the kitchen around them, no trace of human food is visible. Cupboards, shelves, and counters instead hold stacks of books, vinyl records, and dismantled electronic EVE smiles as she makes a move on the chess board, taking ADAM’s queen with her bishop.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: There goes your queen, playboy. Check. Brow furrowed, ADAM studies the board. EVE (cont'd) By the way, your hero Christopher Marlowe sends his regards.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (fixed on the game) I don’t have heroes. And please don’t talk so much. You’re just trying to distract me. (pause) How is he?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Oh, eccentric and secretive as always. I must say he does seem to enjoy being the king of the Tangier underground.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (eyes still on the game) That’s good. lLet’s not talk now.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Adam? He doesn’t respond. EVE (cont'd) Since we were talking about great English poets, will you tell me again about when you hung out with Lord Byron?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Eve, please. ADAM’s hand briefly hovers over a chess piece, but withdr before touching it.  40.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Oh, tell me again. Please? ADAM sighs and briefly looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What? Uh, I was in his presence only for a few days. 1815 maybe, something like that. In a villa on Lake Geneva. With the others.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: On your way to Italy, right?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (eyes again fixed on the game ) Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: And what was he like?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (after a pause, still not looking up) He was a pompous asshole. EVE laughs.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: And what about the great John Keats?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (eyes on the game) What? Keats, Keats I never got to meet. But you know all this, Eve. I know what you’re doing.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Oh, but it amuses me so. Please tell me more.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (distracted) Uh, I met Byron and Mary Shelly. I met Wordsworth once, briefly, by an English lake. (pause) Never met Keats though. (pause, studying the board) Great poet, Keats...

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: “,..That thou wouldst wish thine own heart dry of blood So in my veins red life might stream again...” ADAM looks up at her. Her eyes sparkle with mischief.  4l. EVE (cont'd) So what was Mary like, then? Mary Wollstonecraft. ADAM looks back at the game, trying to ignore her. EVE (cont'd) Come on then, what was she like?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: She was...delicious.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Mmm. I’11 bet she was. They gaze at each other across the table, EVE’s eyes then suddenly lighting up. EVE (cont'd) Oh! That reminds me. I have a surprise! An experiment. She gets up and goes to the refrigerator just behind her. ADAM watches curiously as she opens the freezer.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: That doesn’t work.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (taking something out) Yes it does. I plugged it in. But I must say, you’ve wired this place in a most peculiar way.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (watching her closely) It’s my own system. EVE sits back down, holding two homemade popsicles, froze onto sticks, blood red. She extends one to ADAM. ADAM (cont'd) What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (licking her popsicle) O Negative! Frozen on a stick! Mmm, refreshing. ADAM takes the other from her, examining it carefully, holding the stick hesitantly between two fingers. His ton then barely grazes it.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: That’s disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Mmm. Mine’s delicious.  42. ADAM licks his again, a little less tentatively.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Weird. Never tried it frozen before. Now beginning to enjoy his frozen treat, ADAM’s attention returns to the chess game. EVE watches closely as ADAM carefully moves his remaining castle, then looks up triumphantly. EVE, delighted, eyes locked on the board, immediately tak ADAM’s castle with her queen.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Checkmate, darling.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Damn you, Eve! You’re ruthless.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (rising from the table, smiling) I’m a survivor, baby. As she floats out of the room, her sparkling eyes glance over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (calling after her) It was all the bloody talking! (then, more to himself) I can’t...concentrate. (then to himself, sucking on his popsicle) Mmm. Not bad...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ADAM’S LIVINGROOM - NIGHT ADAM and EVE are now in the livingroom both in bathrobes, with hat and boots. ADAM places a record on an antique player while EVE looks around at his collection of unusual instruments.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (lowering the tonearm onto the spinning disc) You gotta hear this one. It’s Charlie Feathers. Do you know it? EVE shakes her head, listening.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (a moment later) 1956.  43.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just then, the lights flicker then go out with an audible fizz, the turntable slowing to a stop. Darkness. ADAM (cont'd) shit. He fumbles around for a moment, then lights a candle near coffee table. ADAM (cont'd) I can fix it. ADAM now stands near the door, pulling on some Wellington boots and heavy rubber gloves. EVE approaches and he hand her a flashlight

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Weren’t things much more interesting before electrical power? Really, people had more interesting ideas.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ADAM’S BACKYARD - NIGHT Flashlights in hand, ADAM and EVE cross the small, muddy, enclosed backyard. In one corner is a transformer, above amass of tangled wires, some connecting to the house, oth to wooden poles or adjacent buildings. Several wires are unattached and emitting sparks.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (shining his light on the mass of wires) Look at this shit! Idiots. What fucking century is this...I mean, Tesla had lightbulbs you didn’t even have to plug-in -- in fuckin’

While ADAM works on the wires near his transformer, EVE shines her light along the base of a nearby cement wall. Something catches her eye. There, along the grey tones of muddy slush and cement, several red mushrooms are visible. EVE stoops to study th more closely. Small white dots decorate their bright caps

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (to herself) Amanita Muscaria. How odd. (then, louder) Adam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM has opened a metal door on the transformer, and flip the switches of several circuit-breakers. Lights come bac on inside the house. He closes the metal box then moves toward EVE.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Hey, did you see these before?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (bending down next to her) Yeah. Fly Agaric. They’re behaving rather strangely. They appear, disappear, then reappear -- those caps. I guess they’re receiving information from the atmosphere. EVE looks at him curiously.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: But it’s winter.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I know. It’s strange. (pause) We really don’t know shit about fungi, do we? Even though life on this planet wouldn’t exist without them. ADAM gets up and moves back toward the house, while EVE lingers for a moment, shining her light on the bright red mushrooms.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (softly to the mushrooms) You guys shouldn’t be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVE is alone in ADAM’s bed, asleep, radiant under the dim light from a nearby table lamp. After some moments, ADAM enters. He is in his doctor drag white lab coat over green scrubs, stethoscope around his neck, doctor’s bag in hand. EVE shifts and stretches. Her eyes squint sleepily. Then, seeing ADAM, she laughs lightly, gently rubbing her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: What on earth are you doing, my love? (pause) Are we playing ‘doctor’?  45.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (pulling the mask below his face) Iam. (pause) I’11 be back in an hour or two.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (pouting) Oh...am I not included? ADAM approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No. He kneels next to the bed and, taking her head in his han kisses her. He then pulls back and looks into her eyes, EVE’s fingers now touch the stethoscope around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: 1968...Maybe you need a newer one. ADAM stands and looks down at her. EVE (cont'd) (looking up, sensing a change in ADAM) What is it, darling?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I had a dream about...about your sister. EVE sits up halfway.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: You did? (pause) And I don’t suppose it was a good one...

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Could have been worse, I guess. (then, drifting off a little) Well, maybe not by much... ADAM bends and kisses the top her head, then straightens. ADAM (cont'd) Back in a flash.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Hope so. Good luck with the surgery, doctor. He closes the door behind him. EVE sinks back in bed, arm behind her head. Her alert eyes shift from the ceiling to the dimly lit framed portraits lining the walls around he  46. She scans the faces: Baudiliere, Tesla, Mark Twain, Sir Isaach Newton, Edgar Allen Poe, Charlie Patton, Henry Purcell, Emily Dickenson, Luis Bunuel, Iggy Pop, Black El William Blake, William Burroughs, Samuel Beckett, John Coltrane, etc. [all TBD] Her bright eyes then stop, settling on a reproduction of portrait of Christopher Marlowe: it shows a striking youn man, 21 years old, self assured, a bit flashy, arms folde right over left. EVE (cont'd) (softly) Marlowe... She sighs. After a moment her eyes drift back to the ceiling, now as though fixed on something in the far, far distance.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ADAM’S LIVINGROOM - NIGHT All of the few lamps in ADAM’s livingroom are lit and mus ADAM’s, plays from a tape machine. EVE, dressed now in so of ADAM’s ‘60s clothes, moves across the room. Her attention moves to a stack of old vinyl records. As s sifts through them she notices a small, leather-bound, bo like object next to them. Holding it tenderly in her hands, she carefully opens it. is a framed sepia photograph of ADAM and EVE taken in the 19th century, the opposite panel lined in deep red velvet Eve’s fingers lightly caress the fading image.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (softly to herself) June 23rd, 1868...Our third wedding... She kisses the photo, then holds it to her chest. As she moves toward the sofa something glints at her from a partially opened drawer. Her thin hand reaches inside and retrieves ADAM’s silver-plated, pearl-handled revolver. EVE sinks into the sofa, antique photo in one hand, gun i the other. She places the photo on the coffee table, then flips the gun’s magazine open. Her fingers extract a sing bullet from its chamber. She looks at it in the palm of h hand, its tip made of dark, heavy, polished wood. The mus ends.  47. EVE (cont'd) (to herself, studying the wooden bullet) Dalbergia retusa... EVE sighs deeply, her fist closing around the wooden bull her eyes drifting away. A moment later a car is audible, ADAM’s car, stopping outside. Its engine shuts off and a door opens and closes EVE straightens, waiting for him, gun in one hand, bullet enclosed in the other. ADAM’s footsteps are heard on the stairs just before he enters the living room, still parti dressed as a doctor. Confidently, he crosses toward EVE, leather bag in hand. pauses, though, seeing her expression, then the revolver her hand. As their eyes meet, EVE’s fist opens revealing the wooden bullet. EVE (cont'd) So, what’s all this, then? ADAM sets the doctor’s bag on the coffee table and straightens. EVE (cont'd) Tell me you’re having trouble with one of the others. Please tell me that. ADAM shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I don’t see any ‘others’. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Oh. Ok. She deftly flips the revolving magazine open, slides the bullet in the chamber, flips it closed, and spins it. She stands, eyes fixed on ADAM, and quickly presses the gun’s barrel into her chest pointing directly into her heart. S pulls back the hammer. CLICK. ADAM leaps forward in a single motion and snatches the gu from her hand. There is a tense moment, each looking into the other’s smouldering eyes. ADAM exhales, then sits down on the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ hell, Eve. Don’t ever fuck around like that.  48. He removes the wooden bullet from the gun, as EVE sits do next to him.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: I was just trying to make a point.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (upset) Yeah? What is your point?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: The point is, what the fuck is your problem, Adam? You complain incessantly about mortals not appreciating their exquisite gift of consciousness, and then you, who’s exquisite and beautiful and special, you wanna pump a wooden bullet into yourself? There is a heavy pause, ADAM then pocketing the bullet.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (sullenly) That bullet’s just for...reassurance. He quietly sets the gun on the table next to the doctors

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: To reassure you of what? Your own mortality? Your fragility? What, Adam? (Then, shaking her head in dismay) You know, in nature, survival is always more difficult for the predator than its prey. Fewer wolves than deer. Fewer hawks than rabbit. Fewer bats than insects.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, well it’s humans I’m sick of. And their fucking fear of their own imaginations.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, humans... EVE gently touches his face. EVE (cont'd) Soon, though, they’1ll genetically modify themselves. (pause) These are the last of the “organic” ones.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Great. That’1ll be even worse.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s already too late I’m afraid, for the original ones. Their extinction has already started: the water wars, new diseases, devastated planet... (pause) And then you know what will happen?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Rodents will evolve as the predominant mammals. The controlling intelligence on the planet.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (now less morose) Really? (pause) Rat-people?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I thought you’d only mastered the past. Now you can predict the future?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: I’ve seen a lot go past me. (pause) Which just brings be back to my point.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, what was it again?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (caressing his long hair) That you’re such a wanker, Adam. You’re as ridiculously romantic as all your dead poet and astronomer friends put together. She gets up and moves to the stack of records she sifted through earlier. EVE (cont'd) (glancing mischievously over her shoulder) You’ve been quite lucky in love, though, if I may say so. ADAM opens the leather bag, lifting out one of the stainl steel canisters. As he sets it on the table EVE passes, a vinyl record in her hand.  50. EVE (cont'd) Is it the delicious 0 Neg again? ADAM nods. EVE (cont'd) Mmm. She places the 33rpm record on a turntable. It begins to spin. EVE (cont'd) (placing the tonearm on the record) But first, I’m gonna dance. The music begins. It’s a vintage soul song ["Trapped by a Thing Called Love” by Denise LaSalle, TBD]. EVE begins to dance in a style perfectly aligned with the period of the music. ADAM watches her. After a minute or so EVE pulls ADAM up from the sofa, embracing him, and drawing him into a slow dance. EVE (cont'd) (while dancing with ADAM) Let’s get straight and then go for a drive. I haven’t been out of your hovel since I arrived.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Ok. They spin slowly around the room, entwined, the record spinning on the turntable.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT./EXT. ADAM’S CAR - NIGHT ADAM’s white Jaguar moves through the cold streets of Det at night. EVE happily observes the darkened city from the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m just so happy to be out in the world. This is like watching a movie! No response from ADAM. EVE (cont'd) So show me things. Give me a tour!  51.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (sullenly) There’s nothing here.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Oh, come on! I wanna see the ruins. (pause) Show me where all the cool young vampires hang out.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Bloody hell...

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (pointing to an abandoned factory) What was that?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I dunno. Factory where they used to build auto parts. Engine blocks. Or manifolds.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (eyes lit up) How exciting! The ghostly white Jaguar continues down a long, murky str A Detroit police cruiser passes them going in the opposit direction. EVE (cont'd) (quietly) There’s something I should tell you.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Well, I also had a...a dream about my sister.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Are you joking?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: And so did Marlowe, before I left Tangier. She’s looking for us. I’m sure of it.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (disturbed) Oh fuck, Eve. Not again.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Well, it has been a long time, Adam.  52.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No, it hasn’t. It’s been less than 80 years, if I remember correctly.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: It was 84 years ago. In Paris.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, and Paris has never been the same. (pause, then more to himself) 84 years. Seems like fuckin’ yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (distracted) Yeah. Time flies.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Shouldn't she be sleeping in a fucking coffin somewhere? Preferably with a wooden stake shoved in.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Come on, Adam. She is my sister. ADAM looks over at her suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Is she?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: We’re...related by blood. He stares at her a moment longer before his eyes return t the road. The Jag makes another turn then rolls to a stop at a red light. ADAM and EVE watch as two men in dirty, thermal coveralls, cautiously carrying a large rectangular mirror cross directly in front of them. For a moment as they pas the Jag’s windshield is perfectly framed in the large mir In it’s reflection ADAM and EVE are NOT VISIBLE, their ca appearing to be unoccupied. As the men obliviously leave their view, ADAM and EVE gla at each other, EVE then laughing as the light changes and Jag continues. EVE (cont'd) (happily) Ah, I never get tired of the old mirror gag. ADAM smiles. Moments later he points to a building on the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motown.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Oh, fantastic! (then, as it recedes) But, to be honest, except for Smokey and Marvin, and of course the Temps, I was never really a huge Motown fan. Always been more of a Stax girl, ya know?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'd agree. But I’d add the Marvelettes. They continue on in silence for a while.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Adam, I want to take you back to Tangier with me. You loved it there once. (pause) If you do, I’1l get you a beautiful antique stringed instrument, with exotic woods, and pearl inlays.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I have antique instruments.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: But I mean a magical one!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What, you don’t find Detroit magical? 53. EVE’s eyes, bright and alert, take in more images of Detr as they continue to spin past the car’s windows.

dialogues.speaker: FADE
dialogues.text: “I circle your nest tonight, around and around until morning when a breath of air says, NOW, and the Friend holds up like a goblet some anonymous skull” - Rumi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM and EVE, returning from their drive, enter through the front door. They pause abruptly. TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ADAM's foyer  54.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (quietly) Was this light on? He quickly signals to EVE to remain still. Music, ADAM’s music, drifts down from upstairs. They exchange cautious looks, then quietly ascend the staircase, ADAM first.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ADAM’S LIVINGROOM - NIGHT Silently, ADAM looks through the open doorway into the li room. The music swells slightly as ADAM, with EVE looking over his shoulder, sees a girl seated on the couch. It’s EVE’s sister, AVA. She is extremely pale, with darke hair than EVE, at least a decade younger with a petulant, mischievous face. Her shoes are on the floor in front of her, coat also, and she’s wearing a short skirt and tight sweater.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (angrily) What the fuck are you doing here? AVA stands up, excited to see them.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (with English accent) Adam! Eve! Oh my god, it’s so great to see you! She approaches ADAM as he and EVE step into the room. She throws her arms around his neck, ADAM nearly cringing. AVA (cont'd) You’re still so beautiful. ADAM peels her off and she rushes to embrace EVE. ADAM crosses the room and turns off the music. AVA (cont'd) Eve! My darling, totally amazing sister! How I’ve missed you! She unwraps herself enough to look into EVE’s eyes. AVA (cont'd) Did you get my message?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: I think I did. I had a dream...  55.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: Oh, how awesome! It works! AVA laughs and EVE pushes her back a little, still holdin to AVA’s arms.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (to ADAM) Is that what you were talking about earlier? Spooky action at a distance?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (scowling) Yes and no.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: What are you guys talking about?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Listen, Ava, how did you get in here without...without being invited to cross the threshold?

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (laughing again) Oh Eve, you’re so old-fashioned. You’re probably still afraid of garlic! AVA laughs yet again, while EVE and ADAM exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: No. Not garlic. But, my little fool, it’s still quite bad luck to cross the threshold...

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (completing EVE’s sentence) ...of someone’s residence without being properly invited. Yeah, yeah, yeah, nasty luck et cetera.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
