dialogues.text: It’s also bad luck to listen to someone's private music without invitation.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (turning to ADAM) Oh my god I love it, Adam! It’s totally brilliant! Can I get a download?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No!  56. AVA pouts, as Adam and Eve remove their coats.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (tossing her coat over an amplifier) So, just passing through Detroit?

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (sitting back down on the couch) Yes! No! I mean, I came to see you! I had a feeling you were both here. (pause) I’ve been living in L.A...

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: L.A.. Figures. Are you alone?

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: No. ADAM and EVE glance at one another. AVA (cont'd) (bursting into laughter) I’m here with you guys!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck. Well, you can’t stay here.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Adam...

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Not after last time. No fuckin’ way.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Adam, that was 84 years ago.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (fussing with some recording equipment) Not long enough...

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (feigning confusion) What? When? Are you still upset about the Paris thing? EVE crosses and sits on the couch next to AVA.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Are you alone?  57.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: Yeah! (then demurely) But I’m really, really, really hungry. ADAM turns around, facing them. AVA looks back and forth between them, expectantly. AVA (cont'd) (in a childlike voice) Do you maybe have something?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Could you smell it all the way from

dialogues.speaker: L.A.
dialogues.text: EVE scowls and gives ADAM a little nod of her head. ADAM glares at EVE, then reluctantly turns to leave the room. eagerly jumps up and begins to follow him.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Ava! AVA whirls back around.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: I just want to see where you keep it.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (O.S.: already out of the room) No! AVA's head turns, but she remains still for a moment. The as if drawn by an invisible string, she moves back toward and sits down next to her. They look at one another. EVE smiles and, encouraged, AVA throws her arms around her “sister”, childishly burying h head in EVE’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (lifting her head) Oh, Eve. It’s so totally awesome to see you! Again, she hides her face against EVE’s shoulder. With a hint of hesitation, EVE strokes AVA’s hair.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ADAM’S BEDROOM - DAWN EVE is in bed, her head propped on one hand, watching ADA in bathrobe sitting upright on the edge of the bed. ADAM stares sullenly at the floor.  58.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: She drank up a hell of a lot of our Type O Negative. Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: I know. (pause) But, she’s been traveling, and that fucks you up, ya know? Plus avoiding the bloody daylight exposure... She reaches out gently touching ADAM’s back. EVE (cont'd) It’ll be ok. It’s always weird with...relatives. ADAM turns toward her.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: She’s bad news, Eve. (pause) She isn’t sleeping in my fuckin’ studio, is she?!

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: No. I put her to bed in that other bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What other bedroom?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: The small one, downstairs. ADAM looks at her blankly. EVE (cont'd) Just down from the kitchen?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Oh. Right. (pause) Shit. I’11 have to put my fuckin’ tapes in a bloody safe.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (teasing him) Must you curse so much? ADAM reacts by staring at the floor. EVE (cont'd) Come to bed, baby. She’s out cold, and it’s getting light out. You can do that when we get up tonight. ADAM remains motionless, upright, while EVE reaches over turns off the lamp.  59. CUT TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness. A knock is heard from outside the door. Another knock, louder this time.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (O.S., muffled) Eve? Adam? A lamp is switched on, EVE’s arm stretching to it from th bed. Next to her, ADAM wearily opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (sleepily) What is it Ava?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No. AVA opens the door and enters, wearing only a shirt that was wearing earlier, before her arrival. EVE props herself up as AVA sits on the edge of the bed o ADAM’s side. He covers his head with a pillow.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: What is it Ava?

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (lightly stroking ADAM’s pillow) Isn’t it time to get up? It’s dark out already and I’m starving.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (muffled from under the pillow) Go away. We’re still sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Why don’t you go get dressed, and then we'll get up and we can all have breakfast together.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: Some more of that good stuff?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Yeah.  60.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: Where do you keep it?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: You just get dressed and we'll bring you some, ok?

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: Ok. Before getting up she flips up the corner of ADAM’s pillo revealing half of his annoyed face. AVA (cont'd) Peek-a-boo, I see you. ADAM immediately pulls the pillow back over his face. AVA laughs, leans in and kisses EVE on the cheek, then exits. EVE sleepily stares after her as AVA closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ADAM’S LIVINGROOM - NIGHT Now dressed, EVE and ADAM enter the livingroom. EVE carri several wine glasses, while ADAM holds a stainless steel canister. AVA is dramatically sprawled across the velvet couch wear a very short polka-dot dress and platform shoes. One pale hand rests across her forehead. She shifts only slightly EVE sits down, squeezing in next to her. AVA'’s half-open eyes are fixed on ADAM’s old TV screen, connected to a laptop. On the screen is a kitschy image f a 1970s French TV show. Girls in micro-mini dresses dance a very bad pop song, gyrating around a caped male dancer dressed as “Dracula”.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (referring to the TV images) What the hell is this? EVE and AVA’s eyes are locked on the screen as ADAM moves toward it and abruptly switches it off. ADAM (cont'd) What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (whining) Oh...Why did you turn it off? I love that! I found it on YouTube.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Figures...  61. EVE moves AVA’s hand, placing her own on AVA’s forehead.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: I don’t feel good.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: What is it, baby? You think it was the traveling?

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (weakly) Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (pouring blood into wine glasses) Probably blood poisoning... Seeing the red blood AVA pulls herself halfway up.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Don’t joke, Adam.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I’m not.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (to AVA) Have you been especially careful about your food these days, what with all the contamination?

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: I’ve tried. AVA sits up reaching for a glass. ADAM and EVE watch as s guzzles it down.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Take it easy. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (setting down her empty glass) Oh my god! That is good! EVE clinks her glass against ADAM’s and both take sips. A becoming more and more animated, reaches for the stainles canister, but ADAM intercedes. He pours a little more int her glass. AVA drains it immediately.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You’re gonna get sick. And you’re gonna suck down our whole fuckin’ supply, so take it easy. AVA stands and swirls around the room, unsteady, laughing  62.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: Let’s play some of your music, Adam!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (sternly) No. I told you it’s private.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? How come I heard it in L.A. then?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Where did you hear it?

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: In, like, an underground music club.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I don’t believe you.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: So, don’t.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: How did you know it was mine, then?

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: Oh, I could tell immediately! (pause) I might have been born at night, but I wasn’t born last night, ya know. (she laughs) She picks up one of ADAM’s vintage electric guitars. He quickly takes it from her, putting it down in a safer pla AVA shrugs and sits down on EVE’s lap. EVE pushes her off to one side, but AVA puts her arms aro her sister, nuzzling her shoulder like a needy child. AVA (cont'd) Well then I’m gonna go out. I wanna hear some music.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Good idea. Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (babyish) But, I wanna go out with you guys.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: What a big meanie. (then stroking EVE’s hair) I bet he never takes you out, ever, right?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Not true. We went out for a drive just the other night.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: Ooh, a drive. Big deal. I mean go somewhere. Where there’s music. Don’t you wanna go, Eve?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t mind. Adam? ADAM glares at her. AVA springs up from the couch.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: Hurray! Adam’s gonna take us out! Oh my god let’s have another drink!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No! You’ve had more than enough. And no fuckin’ way are we going out. AVA returns to EVE’s side, again embracing her. ADAM look over at the two sisters, their faces wearing similarly pleading, manipulative expressions. ADAM (cont'd) No. That’s absolutely final. He turns away, taking another sip from his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A band is playing messy, very loud, damaged-sounding rock’n’roll on the small stage of a rundown club. Directl opposite the stage is a bar, with racks of bottles behind partially obscuring a long mirror. Between the stage and bar are some tables, and around them people watching the play the last song of its set. Seated around one table, off to the side, are EVE, ADAM, and ADAM’s young “manager”, IAN. EVE wears her white Stet hat while ADAM hides behind dark wraparound sunglasses. A bounces energetically to the discordant music. ADAM leans in toward EVE.  64.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (into her ear) We shouldn’t be in here. (pause) You saw the mirror, right?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (enjoying herself) Don’t worry. Nobody ever notices that. Just relax ok? Enjoy the music. The band finishes, growling guitar feedback mixing with applause from the small crowd. As the musicians step off stage, people begin talking and milling around. Recorded music starts from the jukebox. Several musician types briefly stop by the table to reverently congratulate IAN on the underground success of anonymous record. As they drift away, IAN leans in, smili

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Hey man, this is great! (then to AVA and EVE) I could never get him to go out, hear some live music.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: They were brilliant! Did you like them Adam? No response.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (to ADAM) Hey Adam! You wanna meet them? They’re friends of mine.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (adamantly) No. (pause) Please.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: That’s cool. I read you. He takes a drink from a bottle of beer. IAN (cont'd) (embarrassed) Oh man, I’m sorry. Can I get you guys something? (he turns to AVA) Eve?

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: I’m Ava, she’s Eve.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Oh, right. I’m sorry. What can I get you guys?  65.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (politely) Nothing, thanks. IAN then watches as AVA pulls out a silver flask. She unscrews the top and takes a swig.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Oh, brought your own, huh? That’s cool. What is it, Jagermeister?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (sternly to AVA) Where did you get that?

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: I filled it before we left. At home.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: At home? You mean at my house.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (energized) Yeah! Want some? Extending the flask toward ADAM.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (gently) I‘ll take some. ADAM scowls as EVE drinks from the flask. She smiles at h then offers him the flask. Reluctantly, ADAM takes a drin AVA, smiling, snatches the flask from him and takes anoth big swig.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: Mmm!

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (lightheartedly) Hey, could I maybe get in on that? Mischievously, AVA looks at ADAM as she hands the flask t IAN.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: Sure, Ian. Manically, in a flash, Adam snatches the flask from IAN’s hands before it reaches his lips. Just after, ADAM appear almost surprised by his own actions.  66.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (amazed by the speed) Whoa! That was like some martial arts type shit! (then to AVA) This guy is amazing, man!

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (admiringly) I know. He’s fucking brilliant. And he’s totally hot. ADAM turns toward EVE. She smiles. He takes a swig from t flask, then puts it away inside his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: He is brilliant. I wish he would take credit for it all. While looking at ADAM, AVA strokes IAN’s arm flirtatiousl IAN (cont'd) (leaning in, half whispering) I can’t even tell anyone who he is! How weird is that! I had to sign a confidentiality agreement and everything, man. IAN feels ADAM’s stern glare, even from behind the dark glasses.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (still playfully touching

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: You gonna dance with me, rockstar?

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: What, here? No one else in the club is dancing, but AVA gets up pulli IAN with her. She begins dancing next to their table, briefly drawing some attention from those nearby. IAN at first stands selfconsciously, but after some coaxing from he gradually begins to move a little, trying unsuccessful to appear nonchalant. AVA begins to dance more wildly, her eyes mostly fixed on ADAM. IAN briefly notices this, but just laughs. EVE also notices, an unreadable half-smile on her lips. The music selection changes, and ADAM’s RECORD comes on. stiffens with discernible dread and turns to EVE.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: We gotta get outta here.  67.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Ok, darling. But let’s not panic, or make anything obvious, huh? She smiles at him. They turn to see AVA, now dancing suggestively to ADAM’s slow, unusual music. She locks her eyes on ADAM as she turns and, looking over her shoulder, briefly pulls her short dress halfway over her ass. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (all patience gone) That’s it. We’re leaving right now. ADAM gets up, quickly followed by EVE. As ADAM moves towa the door, EVE deftly reaches out and takes AVA by the han pulling her.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (to AVA) We're leaving now. As they follow in ADAM’s direction, AVA in turn reaches b to grab the hand of IAN, pulling him along as well. ADAM exits as the other three, hands linked, move past th bar and toward the door. Standing at the bar, facing the mirror are the BASS PLAYER and DRUMMER seen earlier on st While the BASS PLAYER looks down at his beer, the DRUMMER gazes absently into the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: VISIBLE IN THE REFLECTION.
dialogues.text: The DRUMMER turns and looks at the doorway, just in time see IAN lurch through it, disappearing outside. He turns back and stares quizzically at the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER
dialogues.text: Did you see that?

dialogues.speaker: BASS PLAYER
dialogues.text: Wait, what?

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER
dialogues.text: Nothing... The DRUMMER shakes his head, then takes a long drink from bottle of beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ADAM’S LIVINGROOM - NIGHT EVE, ADAM, AVA and IAN are in ADAM’s livingroom/studio. E sits on one end of the couch, while at the other end AVA nestled very close to IAN, her hand lightly moving undern the sleeve of his shirt. ADAM, standing, is collecting re and boxes of his tapes. Music plays, but not ADAM’s music

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Couldn’t we just hear a taste of your new stuff, Adam?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (facing away from them) Now’s not a good time.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Oh, man...Last time I saw you, you said that if I came by... ADAM turns and gives him a stern, definitive look. IAN (cont'd) Ok, not now. That’s cool. I’m just, you know, excited. AVA's hand moves to IAN’s leg.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: Me too. Carrying a stack of tape reels and boxes, ADAM moves to t doorway, then turns and nods to EVE. She gets up from the couch.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: It’s getting really late. We all should retire before it starts getting light out. IAN leans forward on the couch, but AVA immediately pulls back toward her.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: Adam? ADAM pauses in the doorway. AVA (cont'd) Could I have that flask back? Please?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No, Ava. I think you’ve had enough.  69.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (pouting) But I’m just so...so thirsty.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (offering his beer bottle to AVA) Wanna share this? AVA petulantly pushes the bottle away.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Ian, I think it’s time for you to go. AVA wraps her arms around him possessively.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: He’s gonna leave as soon as he finishes his little beer. ADAM glares at IAN, who nervously drinks from his bottle.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I should get goin’.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (her arms still encircling him) Yeah. He’s gonna go in just a few minutes. ADAM leaves the room. EVE leans in and kisses AVA on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Goodnight, baby. (then extending her hand to IAN) Nice to meet you, Ian. See you again soon, I hope.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Hope so. EVE moves to the door, looking back briefly at AVA and IA the couch before closing the door behind her. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVE turns a lamp on. She is sitting on ADAM’s side of the bed pulling on her dark red bathrobe, the silver flask in hand. ADAM is still asleep, again with a pillow over his head.  70. EVE pulls up a corner of the pillow and, smiling, peeks a ADAM. He opens one eye.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (groggy) Don’t you dare say it. EVE laughs. ADAM takes the pillow from his head and looks around. ADAM (cont'd) Is it dark out already?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What are ya doin’ with that flask?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: I put a little in for AVA.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck... She touches his head affectionately.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: I’m gonna go check on her. But, you're right, she’s gotta leave. I need to have you all to myself.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Excellent idea, before it’s too late. (pause) I’m getting up, then. EVE kisses him. Before standing, she pauses, looking over their wedding photo which she has moved to the nightstand

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (standing) We look so young, don’t we? ADAM looks over at the photograph, as EVE leaves the room their faces in it appearing identical to the present.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ADAM’S HOUSE - NIGHT Flask in hand, EVE walks down a corridor, passing the upstairs livingroom, then descending the staircase. Downstairs she moves through a narrow hallway, pausing to knock on a door. No response. She pushes the door open slightly.  71. In the small room a light is on. The bed is unmade and empty. AVA’s open suitcase, a transparent raincoat and so clothes are scattered around. EVE turns and heads back to the staircase, ascending to t upper floor. She enters the livingroom, then stops dead i her tracks and gasps. The flask slips from her hand and falls to the floor, blood spilling out onto the carpet. AVA, on the velvet couch, half undressed and disheveled, sprawled on top of IAN. His shirt is ripped open, head tilted back, a dark, open, bruise-colored wound on his ne His skin is blue-grey, one emaciated arm spilling lifeles off the couch and onto the floor. Nearby, ADAM’s antique 1905 guitar lies in pieces. EVE rushes over and pulls AVA up from the couch. AVA come to, but is groggy and disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (looking directly into AVA's half-opened eyes) Ava, what did you do?!

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: Wha? EVE slaps her across the face. AVA (cont'd) Ouch!

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Why did you do that to Ian? AVA looks over at the dead, blue IAN, his corpse complete drained of blood.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (whining immaturely) Oh, I don’t know. AVA struggles to stand but EVE gives her a hard push, and lands back on the couch, sitting on top of IAN. AVA (cont'd) Hey! Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (furious) Explain, Ava!

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: Please, Eve. I don’t know. She looks at IAN’s dead face, his mouth open grotesquely.  72. AVA (cont'd) (whining) I was still so hungry, and he was just so cute. (pause) Now I feel sick.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: No wonder, you idiot. He was in the fucking music business! For fuck’s sake, Ava. This is the twenty-first bloody century! That’s like having unprotected sex! You stupid twat. Now you’ve endangered all of us.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (starting to cry) I didn’t mean to. I just couldn’t resist... EVE and AVA turn to see ADAM, in his bathrobe, standing i the doorway. He has stopped dead in his tracks, in comple shock. He stares at IAN in disbelief, then rushes over an throws AVA to the floor. AVA (cont'd) (landing hard) Ouch! Adam!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (looking closely at IAN, semi-hysterical) I don’t believe this! You fuckin’ drank Ian! You’ve completely drained him! He’s dead! ADAM glares down at AVA. Crawling backwards, she moves a feet away from him. ADAM (cont'd) You slurp down almost all of our O Negative, then you fuckin’ suck Ian dry. Why didn’t you just turn him, at least?

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (whimpering) I...I don’t know...Please! ADAM pulls back his leg to kick AVA.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: No, Adam! ADAM freezes, his leg held back threateningly. AVA sobs. ADAM turns to EVE.  73.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (seething) I should kill her. AVA makes retching noises.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Well, kicking her head in would hardly accomplish that.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Where’s the gun then? EVE rises and goes to ADAM, pulling him close. She looks his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Listen. Ava’s gotta get out of here, and we have to deal with this.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (yelling) Get her outta here then! I don’t even want to look at her. EVE goes to AVA and pulls her to her feet, half-dragging across the room to the door. AVA continues whimpering. AD looks down at IAN. ADAM (cont'd) (furious, to AVA without looking at her) You stupid little bitch! He was my fragile link to the outside! He was my fucking manager! EVE and the whimpering AVA can be heard noisily descendin the staircase just outside the door, while ADAM stands motionless, still looking down at IAN’s corpse on the cou

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ADAM’S HOUSE - NIGHT AVA, pushed from behind, lurches out ADAM’s front door. S has her luggage in one hand and a transparent raincoat on halfway on. ADAM stands in the doorway, EVE just behind h

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (crying) Where am I supposed to go?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Go back and rot in fuckin’ L.A., where you belong.  74. ADAM disappears inside, leaving EVE at the door.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (pleading tearfully) Eve, please! I didn’t mean it! I’m not well! You’re my only sister.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: You have to go. AVA backs away from the house, sobbing. EVE closes the do from inside. AVA wipes at her running mascara, then looks at the house.

dialogues.speaker: AVA
dialogues.text: (crying quietly) You know what you guys are? You’re condescending snobs! Just wait. (sniffle) You’1ll find out what the world is really like out there. She pulls her coat on and, buttoning it clumsily, disappe down the empty, darkened street.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ADAM’S LIVINGROOM - NIGHT EVE reenters to find ADAM frantically pacing around the r

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (smouldering) Uncivilized bitch. What does she think this is, the fucking fifteenth century?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry. He seemed like a lovely fellow.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Now just my Achilles heel.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: No one can connect you with him, can they?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? We were out with him last fuckin’ night! Soon they’1l certainly be bloody lookin’ for him.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Yeah. So much for that confidentiality agreement.  75. ADAM stops pacing and glares at her, then looks down at h broken antique guitar.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (despondent) Even my fucking 1905 Gibson L2. Destroyed. EVE bends over the broken guitar, delicately examining it interior construction.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (softly, sincerely) Look how beautifully it was made inside. ADAM whirls and kicks the guitar, breaking it further and scattering its pieces. Shielding herself, EVE quickly ris watching ADAM with concern as he continues pacing frantically.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (stopping and turning to EVE, accusingly) Why did you invite that little bitch here, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (flaring up) I didn’t fucking invite her! Don’t blame me for this.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Fuck. He paces some more, then leaves the room. EVE sits down o the edge of the couch next to IAN, forlorn. ADAM returns with a brown tarp and some rope. He is weari heavy, rubber, work gloves, and tosses another pair at EV

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (standing up, putting on the gloves) What’s the plan, then?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (unfurling the tarp) The plan? I don’t have a fuckin’ plan. I don’t really plan for this kind of shit! All I know is we better get rid of him fast. The two roll IAN off the couch and onto the tarp, pulling around him. ADAM loops the rope around the tarp and begin tying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. ADAM’S CAR - NIGHT ADAM angrily, recklessly, drives his Jag through the Detr night, EVE solemn in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Take it easy. Let’s just stay calm.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (exploding) Stay calm?!

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (softly) Please, Adam. She reaches over and touches his shoulder, but he shrugs away and she withdraws her arm. A police car passes them, traveling in the opposite direction. EVE (cont'd) What are we gonna do with him? ADAM doesn’t respond. EVE (cont'd) In the old days we could just chuck ‘em in the Thames...alongside all the other tubercular floaters.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Any other ideas?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (after a pause, trying to lighten the mood) We could put him through a wood- chipper. Like in the movie FARGO. ADAM glances over, questioningly. EVE (cont'd) You didn’t see FARGO?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I have no idea what you’re talking about.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: A movie. It’s got Steve Buscemi in it. I love him.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (tersely) I don’t know who that is.  77.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Darling, you’re so...unhip. ADAM glances at her, a hint of insecurity flashing across brooding eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Am I? EVE looks forward, smiling, her eyes again bright and irrepressible.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ADAM’S CAR - NIGHT The car moves through a completely deserted post-industri area. It turns again, pulling down a narrow alley, which then widens into an open area partially enclosed by broke factory walls. The ghosts of old machinery stand rusting collapsed. The Jag slows, then stops. Its headlights illuminate a very large corroded metal tan rusting metal staircase leading to a platform near its ri In the surrounding area rusting barrels are tossed here a there, leaking small pools of strangely colored liquid chemicals.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (surveying the landscape through the windshield) Delightful. ADAM turns and checks behind him, then switches off the headlights, leaving the engine running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Together ADAM and EVE drag the tarped body from the car toward the large chemical tank.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Is this like in BATMAN, when they throw the Joker into the acid?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah, sort of, only he was still alive. Suddenly an eerie sound causes them to freeze. Not far of group of coyote howl and yip uncannily.  78.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Tell me I’m crazy, but those are most definitely Canis Latrans.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. Coyote.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Interesting. In the heart of Detroit?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You'd be surprised. The sounds subside, the coyote moving off. ADAM and EVE resume, dragging the corpse to the staircase at the base the tank. They carry it up the staircase, seemingly witho difficulty, indicating prior experience in the physics of moving corpses. Reaching the platform at the top, they pause and peer int the tank, reactively covering their mouths and noses. Thr or four meters below them is a surface of thick, oily, li emitting a visible vapor. EVE glances at ADAM. ADAM (cont'd) Don’t even ask. (pause) You ready? They hoist the wrapped corpse to rim of the tank, then ro it over the side. Immediately they both take cover, crouching behind the tank’s exterior wall. The corpse lands with a dull splash, as though the sound slowed down. After a pause, still covering their faces, A and EVE cautiously peer into the tank. The wrapped corpse is visibly disintegrating as it slips the thick fluid. The top corner of the tarp, however, has come unfurled, revealing IAN’s grimacing, blue face. Riveted, ADAM and EVE watch as the face disintegrates, sk melting from bone, the skull and teeth then ghoulishly sinking below the surface. A moment later no visible trac of IAN is left. ADAM and EVE look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: My, that was certainly...visual. ADAM turns and descends the rusty metal stairs, EVE then following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM is manically pacing in the small room, his fingers twisting his hair. EVE sits calmly on the bed, watching h Clothes and objects are strewn everywhere, and drawers fl open. Piles of money in various denominations, as well as passports, jewelry, and credit cards are scattered across surface of the bed surrounding EVE. Still pacing and losing control, ADAM reaches into an ope drawer and flings a handful of U.S. bills into the air.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (money fluttering down around him) Need anything? We’re having a liquidation sale. Everything must go! He tosses a stack of loose euros toward EVE. They float d around her like falling leaves. ADAM (cont'd) (ranting) Have some more of mankind’s most useless and tragic invention! He whirls around holding a box containing reels of record audio tapes; master tapes of his music. ADAM (cont'd) (wildly) How about some cult music? Mind bending guitar drone. Recorded in secret by a real fucking vampire! He tosses the box, his arm then sweeping a stack of antiq leather-bound books to the floor. He whirls back toward E ADAM (cont'd) What!? Did you say...blood? Ah, I see. Not money, not art, but it’s blood you want! (he turns away, eyes wild) That’s right! What’s more precious than human blood? He turns to EVE, holding up the small silver flask, his e now fluttering in his head. He takes a step toward her, almost menacingly. ADAM (cont'd) Type O! The original blood of Adam and Eve? That’s what we need, but...not much of that left, is there? In fact, almost none! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM (cont'd) (pause, then in an unusual voice) Sorry, but me wife’s sis’ turned up and she sucked it all down! (then, moving even closer) Then she sucked up my business partner. Just like that!

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (quietly) Adam, you're upsetting me.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Am I?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Let’s just calm down. (pause) What we’re going to do is calmly get the hell out of here. Suddenly the doorbell rings. Both freeze momentarily, the ADAM rushes to the window. Pulling the curtain back very slightly, he peeks out. The bell rings again. Outside he sees the same group of young hipsters who rang bell earlier. Several are on his porch, and several more a car parked in the street. EVE (cont'd) Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Some fucking rock’n’roll kids. (then closing the curtain) They’re onto me. We’re fucked. The bell rings again.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (calmly) Don’t be ridiculous. They’1ll go away. Good job it isn’t the authorities.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (again peering through a thin opening in the curtain.) Yeah, well, they’1ll be next.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (turning on her white mobile) We'll be long gone, baby. She scrolls then dials a number on the phone, then waits.  81. EVE (cont'd) (calmly into phone) Yes, I’d like to make some reservations. (pause) Thank you. The sound of a car pulling away is heard. ADAM closes the curtain and turns to EVE, a wild look in his eyes. EVE (cont'd) (into phone) Yes, I want to book flights for two to Tangier. (pause) Yes, from Detroit, flying at night please. (pause) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What about my equipment and all my fucking instruments!?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (to ADAM, hand over the phone) Oh fuck your bloody instruments. There are millions of beautiful instruments in the world. Calm down. (then, back into phone). Excuse me? (pause) Oh, connecting through London? Her eyes are on ADAM, who spins away from her, fingers ag entangled in his hair. EVE (cont'd) (calmly into phone) London’s not good. How about... (pause) Oh, yes, Madrid is good. And that flight is also at night?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (spinning around) I can’t do this! I won’t survive the bloody trip.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (into phone but glaring at

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yes. Oh, for tonight! First class, please, for two. EVE’s fingers pluck a credit card from the pile in front her. She raises it to her eye level, then looks up at ADA He begins to spin slowly, disturbingly, in front of her, his hands now tangled in his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM and EVE are seated in first class on an airplane. Th interior is darkened, all other visible passengers asleep ADAM also appears to be asleep, slouched in the window se his gaunt face mostly covered by hair and dark glasses. E in the aisle seat next to him, also wears dark glasses. Though noticeably more fragile than before, she sits upri alert and wide awake, as her thin hands caress their wedd photo cradled in her lap. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: OVER BLACK
dialogues.text: “A secret turning in us makes the universe turn. Head unaware of feet, and feet head. Neither cares. They keep turning.” - Rumi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVE struggles to help ADAM out of a taxi in the somewhat down quarter of Tangier near EVE’s apartment. The Morocca driver lifts their suitcases from the car’s open trunk. EVE pays him and he thanks her politely. They pick up the luggage as the car pulls away. ADAM now quite frail, is having trouble walking. He stops propping himself against a wall. Two shadowed figures pass them, one pausing in front of t briefly to offer “something really special”, first in Fre then English. EVE shakes her head definitively and the figure moves away.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (now taking ADAM’s arm) Come on baby, we’re almost there.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (weakly) It’ll be dawn soon.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (she glances at the sky) It'll be fine, we’ve got time.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: But did you reach Marlowe?  83.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: No, which concerns me a little. (pause) But we’ll find him, I’m sure. Come on. They make it to the next corner, EVE pausing to look up a the building where she lives. EVE (cont'd) (visibly surprised) That’s odd.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (leaning on her) What?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: My lights are on.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (exhausted) Oh, great. What next? EVE still holds his arm as they make it across the street enter her building.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. EVE’S BUILDING / HALLWAY - NIGHT ADAM and EVE ascend the narrow staircase as quietly as possible. They pause in front of the door to EVE’s apartment, listening. From behind the door voices, both adults and children, can be heard speaking Arabic. On the floor next to the door, in a neat row, are five pairs of shoes, three in children’s sizes. EVE slips her key in the door and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. EVE’S APARTMENT - NIGHT EVE stands in her doorway looking in, ADAM propped up jus behind her. The voices are quiet. Looking back at them is a family of Moroccans seated on t floor around one of EVE’s low tables. On its surface something is cooking on a hotplate. A clothesline dissect the apartment, draped with drying laundry. There is a long silent pause. The family: a man, woman, a girl and two smaller boys, stare in surprise and amazemen the gaunt strangers in the doorway. All of the family hav large, dark, sympathetic eyes.  84.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (in Arabic, wide-eyed but calm) What’s going on here? This is my apartment. The woman glances at the man, then stands up and immediat begins to gather their belongings, the girl instinctively springing up to help her. The man nods toward the two boy then stands.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) We are extremely sorry. We were told this apartment had been possibly permanently vacated. This is an embarrassing accident. While he is talking ADAM and EVE step into the room, ADAM stumbling toward the bed, then collapsing onto it. The man speaks to the small boys who are now standing, bu staring at EVE. MAN (cont'd) (in Arabic, to the boys) Quickly, help gather our things! We must leave, right now! The entire family now rushes around the apartment, gather their belongings and packing them into several large, zippered, plastic duffels. The boys quickly strip the clothesline, while the girl retrieves articles of clothin from the bed. ADAM, half conscious, comes-to briefly as t girl pulls a shawl from under him.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (shifting and looking groggily at the young girl) Oh, sorry. With remarkable speed, the family finishes packing. As th MAN talks to EVE, the rest move in a group toward the doo the boys with the duffels, the woman and girl wrapping sh around their heads and faces.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) I can’t apologize more sincerely. We had no other place to go. My family and I are ashamed by this unfortunate misunderstanding. The family has moved out the door and, hanging his head, man turns to follow them.  85.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Wait. The MAN turns and EVE hands him some folded bills. He sha his head, unable to accept. EVE (cont'd) (in Arabic, putting the money in his hand) I insist. Find another place. The man backs out the door, half bowing.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Bless you. Again, my apologies.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Nevermind, but I still live here. She closes the door and leans against it, arms folding ac her chest. She surveys the disheveled state of her apartment. Furniture rearranged, ADAM unconscious on the bed. She crosses the room, making sure the curtains are tightl closed. CUT TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: FADE UP TO
dialogues.text: INT. EVE’S APARTMENT - LATE EVENING Spinning slowly clockwise, and viewed from above, ADAM an EVE are ‘asleep’ on the bed. They’re still fully clothed, EVE’s head resting on ADAM’s shins, the room softly lit b several lamps. The spinning slows and stops. From outside, the haunting call-to-prayer can be heard faintly in the distance. After a few moments EVE’s eyes open. They are less alert than usual. She rubs them, and looks around her. She look at her watch. Slowly she sits up and retrieves her white phone from the nightstand. She turns it on and dials a number, then waits. After a moment she turns the phone off, concern apparent in her expression.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (quietly to herself) Damnit, Marlowe, where are you?  86. She stares off into space for a moment, then turns toward ADAM. Looking down at him, she lovingly caresses his hair then runs the back of her hand across his sunken cheek. Then, raising his hand in hers, she kisses his wedding ri then replaces his arm. EVE gently rocks ADAM’s shoulders, now attempting to wake him. He remains unconscious, silent and unmoving. She roc him again, harder. Still no results. EVE (cont'd) Damnit, Adam! She pulls his hair away from one side of his face, then s him sharply across the cheek. A moment later ADAM stirs and grunts, then groggily raise one hand to his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (in a delayed reaction) Oww. (pause, eyes opening half way) What was that for? EVE smiles wanly, then leans in and kisses him on the che she had struck. ADAM (cont'd) (rising to his elbows with difficulty) Where are we? He rubs his bleary eyes, looking around him. ADAM (cont'd) (weakly) Did you find Marlowe?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: No, not yet. But you gotta get up. We’re gonna go find him.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (pulling himself up a fraction higher) If I can even fuckin’ walk... EVE helps hoist him into a sitting position.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (gently) It'll be alright, baby. She strokes his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM and EVE walk shakily through the shadowed corridors the Medina, ADAM partially supporting himself on EVE’s shoulder. She is also weak, but determined. They move past several men outside a dim cafe. One approaches them, speaking in English.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN STREET
dialogues.text: I have something very special for you.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (faintly) Not what I need, I’m sure.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN STREET
dialogues.text: Are you sure? Then, after getting a better look at the strange couple a they pass through a shaft of dim light, he retreats. MAN IN STREET (contd) (in English) No, perhaps not. At the next corner they pause, looking across the small square of the Petit Socco. On the opposite side is the ON THOUSAND AND ONE NIGHTS CAFE, where EVE had her previous rendezvous with Marlowe. This time though its lights are turned off, its doors closed and shaded.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Come on. They stumble across the square, arriving at the locked do of the cafe. EVE knocks on the door. No response.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (slouching) Shit, baby. We’re not gonna make it. EVE knocks again, much louder this time. She turns and lo around them, propping ADAM up against her. Just then, there is the sound of someone approaching the from inside. A lock turns and the door opens a crack. Par of a man’s face is visible. The door then opens wider. It is the Moroccan BARMAN who was there before.  88. His eyes are wide, worried. He quickly ushers EVE and ADA through the door and into the darkened cafe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Moroccan BARMAN cautiously locks the door behind them then turns to face EVE, his sympathetic eyes on the verge tears.

dialogues.speaker: BARMAN
dialogues.text: (in English) Madame, the boss is not well. This is a very bad situation. Very bad. As he says this he briefly takes EVE’s hand in his own. Letting it go, he turns and crosses beyond the bar, stopp near a closed door. Opening it, he turns to them. BARMAN (cont'd) Please, this way. EVE and ADAM cross and pass through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BARMAN closes the door and turns to face them. The ro is a relatively small office; a library lined with bookshelves, there is a desk, several chairs, and a tea- table. Books are stacked everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: BARMAN
dialogues.text: (crossing the small room) This is our private library. He presses on a leather-bound book in one of the bookcase The entire section of wall opens, revealing a secret door Again he motions to them and they cross and move through opening into a hidden room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just behind EVE, ADAM and the BARMAN, the door mechanical closes. The room is medium-sized, windowless, and lit by lamps and candles. It’s walls are dark, it’s furnishings mixture of antique European and Moroccan. A small desk si in a corner, its surface a mess of handwritten manuscript Central to the room however is an antique daybed with a reclining figure under a dark red, velvet cover.  89. It’s Marlowe, pale, weak and thin. His eyes slowly open a light up faintly as they locate his visitors. With effort he lifts one hand, palm down, toward EVE.

dialogues.speaker: MARLOWE
dialogues.text: (half whispering) Well, well. Look what the cat dragged in. EVE steps over and takes his hand, kissing it, and kneeli next to him.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: My dear Christopher Marlowe.

dialogues.speaker: MARLOWE
dialogues.text: You look...like shit. Over her shoulder he sees the BARMAN near the door, then who is again propped against a wall. MARLOWE (cont'd) (to ADAM) [He quotes from Hamlet - TBD]

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (to MARLOWE) [He responds with a quote from Hamlet - TBD] This elicits a weak smile from MARLOWE.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: What happened, Kit? Feebly his hand feels for something next to him, under th velvet bed-cover. He lifts a tarnished, inlaid flask and attempts to hand it to EVE. She takes it from him.

dialogues.speaker: MARLOWE
dialogues.text: (his voice now weaker) It’s the last of the (cough) good stuff. (pause) It’s too late for me. EVE opens the top and takes a small sip. Then reaching behind her, she hands the flask to ADAM. He takes a sip immediately, then sluggishly hands the flask back to EVE. MARLOWE (cont'd) No more good French doctor. I...got some bad stuff. Contaminated. Avoid...the hospital...here. As EVE slides the flask into her pocket the Moroccan BARM approaches and also kneels next to the bed.  90. MARLOWE looks at him affectionately, and the man takes MARLOWE’s hand, his dark eyes beginning to tear. ADAM, having regained a small amount of strength, steps o to the writing desk which is lit by a candle.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Still been scribbling a bit, then, Kit? The others look over, MARLOWE’s eyes slowly following.

dialogues.speaker: MARLOWE
dialogues.text: Oh, you know...Here and there over the (cough) centuries... ADAM lifts the candle to a portrait on the wall. It’s a familiar image of William Shakespeare, framed in dark woo with a knife firmly planted in the forehead. Seeing it, E laughs lightly.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Well, there he is.

dialogues.speaker: MARLOWE
dialogues.text: (with a sudden jolt of energy) Illiterate! ADAM sets the candle down on a table under the portrait a turns to MARLOWE.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. But they pulled it off, didn’t they, Kit? And you played along.

dialogues.speaker: MARLOWE
dialogues.text: (his voice fading) Had no choice, really...it was (cough) highly political. After all, I was supposed to be...dead. (cough) EVE and the BARMAN now each hold one of MARLOWE’s skeleta hands. MARLOWE makes an effort to look into EVE’s eyes. MARLOWE (cont'd) And now, at last...I shall be. MARLOWE’s eyes drift back to the defaced portrait of Shakespeare. MARLOWE (cont'd) (his voice nearly gone) Mindless...entrepreneurial... bastard.  91. MARLOWE’s eyes close. His breathing stops. EVE, tears streaming, gently strokes his hair. The BARMAN leans in, burying his head in MARLOWE’s chest. He begins sob. ADAM slowly steps over and kneels, with the other two, ne to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (reverently) Great fucking poet.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (crying softly) If the world could only know... ADAM lifts MARLOWE’s hand to his lips and kisses it, then gently replacing the dead man’s arm. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: OVER BLACK
dialogues.text: “I want to hold you close like a lute, so we can cry out with loving. You would rather throw stones at a mirror I am your mirror and here are the stones.” - Rumi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM and EVE hover somberly in a narrow alley behind some buildings not far from the cafe. Silently they lean against a wall, shoulder to shoulder. EVE, face still streaked from her tears, carefully takes the flask and takes a small sip. She hands it to ADAM who sips, then tilts the flask approximating it’s meager contents. He then hands it back to EVE. ADAM’s head rolls back against the wall. He studies a tangled mass of electrical wires just above him, hanging the buildings.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Look at that shit. EVE’s head tilts back. ADAM (cont'd) How fuckin’ ridiculous.  92.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (teasing, imitating him) Yeah, stupid bloody humans. After a brief reaction from ADAM, there is a moment of silence. Then suddenly they speak in unison.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM AND EVE
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do? There is a pause before EVE laughs. ADAM attempts to scow

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Hey, I know what I’m gonna do.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: I’m gonna give you a present. She holds onto him tightly. EVE (cont'd) We're gonna go a few blocks away, and you're gonna wait for me there. Ok?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What? Ok.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Do you have any money on you? She kisses his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Uhh, yeah. A lot.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (bright eyed) Good. Give me all your money, baby. Her arms still around him, his hand fumbles to locate his outer coat pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM leans against a wall in the shadows. He is on a narr street just off the Petit Socco, peering into the open, f windows of a bar or small club. From inside, hallucinator music mixes traditional Middle Eastern and North African forms with something more modern and equally entrancing.  93. Most remarkable, though, is how the music slowly swirls around a single female voice, half whispering the vocals Arabic ADAM becomes mesmerized. Several shadowy figures pass him one pausing.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOWY FIGURE
dialogues.text: (in French) I have something very special, my friend. ADAM waves him away, absorbed by the music. From over his shoulder the musicians can be seen inside. Several seated players with traditional clothes and instruments half-encircle the singer. She is a striking young woman with long dark hair, wearing tight jeans and dark t-shirt. She is catlike and sinuous, her voice a str yet delicate instrument. She is riveting. Someone touches ADAM from behind him and he stiffens and turns. EVE is there standing next to him, concealing a fairly large object behind her back. Again her eyes are bright, but with dark circles around them, as are ADAM’s.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Shit, man, you startled me.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Sorry, darling. She kisses him on the cheek. His eyes are drawn back to t musicians.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (enthusiasm somehow leaking through his depleted state) Eve, check this out. This chick is fantastic. EVE peers through the window. The singer slowly spins as sings.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. She’s called Yaz. She's Lebanese.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You know her?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Just her music. (pause) They say she’s gonna be a big star, though.  94.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (still absorbed) God, I hope not. (pause) She’s way too good for that.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (observing him) You wanna go in?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (propped against the wall) No. I couldn’t handle it, I don’t think. He turns to EVE and notices by the way she’s standing tha she’s concealing something behind her. ADAM (cont'd) What’s all this, then?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Your present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVE, smiling, backs away from him and into a small market stall. Adam follows, and EVE presents him with a beautifu antique, inlaid lute. ADAM’s sunken eyes lock on the instrument as she gently delivers it into his hands.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (proudly) 1605. ADAM plucks several strings and holds the body of the lut his ear. EVE (cont'd) Been eyeing it for you for years. You never know, maybe it was John Dowland’s. ADAM half-stumbles toward her, holding the lute with one and embracing her with the other.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It’s exquisite. Thank you. (pause) Though a rather odd time to be giving me a present.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (brightly) But I told you I would.  95. A shadowed figure passes by the stall, pausing to briefly peer in at them. It then moves away.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Let’s get out of here. (pause) Can we go down by the water? I need to see some water. EVE nods and takes his hand, pulling him back into the di narrow street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each with one arm around the other, and ADAM clutching th lute to his chest, the two move precariously around a cor then recede unsteadily across the small, dirty square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a small, deserted public terrace in the Ville Nouvelle ADAM and EVE sit looking out onto a sweeping view of the port. Its water is black and glittering. In the light their skin is luminously white, their featur frail and sunken. ADAM holds the lute across his lap. Aft a silence, EVE carefully opens MARLOWE’s flask and takes sip. She then passes it to ADAM. As he drinks, the angle the flask makes it clear that very little of the fluid is left inside. ADAM hands it back to her, both again gazing out at the water.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (distantly) 82% of human blood is water. (pause, he turns to her) Have the water wars started yet? Or is it still about the oil?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (looking off) Yeah, they’re already starting.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (eyes returning to the dancing water) They only figure it out when it’s too late, don’t they?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (after a pause) How much of a human’s body is water?  96.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: About 55 to 60%.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: And how much of the earth’s surface?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Uh, well, 70% is covered in ocean (pause) then there are lakes, rivers... ADAM begins to gently pluck the strings of the lute, soon finding a haunting, minimal pattern of notes. EVE listens calmly as the tones from the antique wood resonate, delicately mixing with the sparse sounds of the sleeping and city around them. ADAM’s music now begins to falter. His hands and fingers beginning to tremble. He stops playing. ADAM (cont'd) Fuck. (pause) I’m barely still here. EVE opens the flask and holds it up to his lips, only a f drops entering them. She then lets another drop fall on h own tongue. ADAM (cont'd) That’s the last of it, isn’t it? (pause, his head now back looking at the black sky). Oh, Eve. Someone call an angel down. It’s gettin’ too dark here on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Feebly, she tosses the empty flask out toward the black water. A moment later a small “splash” is audible. EVE th places a hand on ADAM’s trembling fingers.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: And Kit said to avoid the hospital, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Again they stare listlessly off into the water. ADAM’s fingers again begin to pluck the lute strings, though eve more slowly this time. As EVE looks into the water, ADAM half-notices a young Moroccan couple approaching.  97. They laugh, then stop near a railing some distance away oblivious to ADAM and EVE’s presence. The young couple begins a long, passionate kiss, their arms fully encircli each other. EVE now notices them too, watching approvingly for a mome before her eyes return to the water. EVE (cont'd) (softly) Tell me now about Einstein’s theory that you mentioned, Spooky Action at a Distance. (pause, then looking over at him) Does it have something to do with quantum theory?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (still slowly plucking the lute) Yeah. No. I mean, it’s nota theory, it’s been proved.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Yeah? So, what is it? He stops playing.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (speaking slowly, weakly) Well, when you separate an entwined particle and move the two parts far away from each other, even at opposite ends of the universe, then if you alter or affect one, the other will, spookily, be identically altered or affected. EVE again observes the young Moroccan couple, still enfol in their endless kiss.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Even at opposite ends of the universe?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah. EVE turns to ADAM, leaning in and engaging him in a long kiss. She then pulls back a little, and they gaze into ea others eyes.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: And what if these particles...are in alternate universes?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Well...I guess then...uh...hmm...  98. EVE smiles and rests her head on his shoulder. Her attent drifts back to the young lovers nearby, as does ADAM’s. T young Moroccan’s lithe bodies remain pressed against one another, lips locked, hands caressing each other, the dar water glittering just behind them. There is a period of silence, ADAM and EVE continuing to observe them. EVE eventually glances at ADAM.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Is that what we’re thinking? ADAM doesn’t respond, his eyes now ghoulishly locked on t embracing couple. EVE (cont'd) Adam, really. That’s so fuckin’ fifteenth century. ADAM looks over at her, then both again drift back to the lovers entwined, entranced, completely oblivious to the w around them. EVE (cont'd) They are deliciously beautiful aren’t they?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (half delirious) What choice do we have, really?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (after a pause) I guess for once you’re right. (pause) But we’re only gonna turn them. Ok?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: How romantic of you. (then after another pause, eyes on the couple) Ok. I get the girl, though. EVE gently slaps him. She then braces herself and stands. She takes a deep breath. ADAM carefully puts down the lut next to him, then using the back of the bench for support shakily pulls himself into a standing position. He turns EVE and she looks deeply into his eyes. EVE then turns and descends toward the young embracing couple. ADAM, one arm still holding the bench for balance pauses, watching her intently. Confidently, EVE walks up to the young lovers.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Excuse me.  99. The couple's dazed heads slowly separate, their bleary ey attempting to focus on the source of this interruption. CUT TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: OVER BLACK
dialogues.text: “Love is for vanishing into the sky. The mind, for learning what men have done and tried to do. Mysteries are not to be solved. The eye goes blind when it only wants to see why.” - Rumi FADE TO BLACK.
